queis: <entryFree id="n40072" type="main" key="queis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">queis</orth> = ques, also for quibus, v. 1. qui <sense id="n40072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quemadmodum: <entryFree id="n40073" type="main" key="que^madmo^dum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĕmadmŏdum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">quĕm ad mŏ-dum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n40073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in what manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how</hi> (cf.: quomodo, quī). </sense><sense id="n40073.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Interrog.</hi>: facere amicum tibi me potis es sempiternum. <hi rend="ital">Sa.</hi> Quemadmodum? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non reliquit: quemadmodum ab eo postea exegisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:18:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 18, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ad modum est adservatus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:27:section=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 27, § 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 2, 1</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40073.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rel.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego omnem rem scio, quemadmodum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper vigilavi, et providi, quemadmodum salvi esse possemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 2, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40073.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40073.4" n="1" level="3"> Corresp. with <hi rend="ital">sic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ita</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">just as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemadmodum urbes magnas viculis praeferundas puto, sic, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si, quemadmodum soles de ceteris rebus ... sic de amicitiā disputaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 16</bibl></cit>. — Corresp. with <hi rend="ital">ita</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15</bibl>, a, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:1:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 1, 11</bibl>; with <hi rend="ital">item</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 34, 110</bibl>; with <hi rend="ital">eodem modo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:26:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 26, 83</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with adaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:43:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 43, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40073.5" n="2" level="3"> In introducing examples, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as for instance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemadmodum C. Caesar inquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:20" default="NO">2, 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:56" default="NO">8, 6, 56</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 2, 36 al.: quemadmodum si,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:20:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 3, 20, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
queo: <entryFree id="n40074" type="main" key="que^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĕo</orth>, <itype>īvi and ii, ĭtum</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. Sanscr. ?*!vay āmi, am strong or able</etym>, <sense id="n40074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be able</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I</hi> (<hi rend="ital">thou</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">can</hi> (class.; esp. freq. with a negation; Cic. does not use nequeo in the first pers. sing.; for a full account of the forms in use, v. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 607 sqq.; cf.: possum, polleo, valeo).—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non queo reliqua scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quit sentire dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod vos dicere non quitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod manu non queunt tangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">queam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">queas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">queat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 58:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 58, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">queamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si queant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:4:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quibam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 8, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quirem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. prol. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 15, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:60" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec credere quivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 463</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 19, 2</bibl>: quiit, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quivimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quistis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 2, 679</bibl></cit>: quiverunt, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quivero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:32:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 32, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:855" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 855</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiveritis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiverint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 8, 24, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quissent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 175, 9</bibl></cit>; in <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">queunte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1422</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Affirmatively: hoc queo dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere quod queant dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 20, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:37:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 37, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">queat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">queamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">queunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 44, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 22</bibl>. — In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: si non sarciri quitur, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 380</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">percipi queuntur, Att. ib.: suppleri queatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1045" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1045</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subigi queantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: neque vi impelli, neque prece quitus sum, <hi rend="ital">could not be driven</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 380</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">forma nosci non quita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 57</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollicitus ita facturum, ne sic quidem quitus est,</quote> <trans><tr>could not</tr>, <tr>was not able</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 274, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quercerus: <entryFree id="n40075" type="main" key="querce^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quercĕrus</orth>, v. querquerus.</entryFree>
quercetum: <entryFree id="n40076" type="main" key="querce_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quercētum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">querquētum</orth>, Fest. s. v. querquetulanae, p. 261 Müll.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>quercus</etym>, <sense id="n40076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an oak-wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oak-forest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">querceta laborant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 7</bibl></cit>; Fest. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
querceus: <entryFree id="n40077" type="main" key="querce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quercĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of oak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oak</hi>- (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">querceae coronae,</quote> <trans><tr>garlands of oak-leaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 3" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 772</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quercicus: <entryFree id="n40078" type="spur" key="querci^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quercĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um, a false reading for querneus</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 19</bibl>; v. querneus.</entryFree>
quercinus: <entryFree id="n40079" type="main" key="querci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quercĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quercus</etym>, <sense id="n40079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of oak-leaves</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quercus: <entryFree id="n40080" type="main" key="quercus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quercus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<sense id="n40080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> querci, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 7, 8</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> quercorum, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 717</bibl> P.; <case>dat.</case> and <hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> do not occur), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. from root kar (kal-k), to be hard; cf.: cornu calx, calculus</etym>. </sense><sense id="n40080.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An oak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oaktree</hi>, esp. the <hi rend="ital">Italian</hi> or <hi rend="ital">esculent oak</hi>, sacred <cb n="QUER" /> to Jupiter (cf. robur): quercus dicitur, quod id genus arboris grave sit ac durum, tum etiam in ingentem evadat amplitudinem: querqueram enim gravem et magnam putant dici, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=259" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 259</bibl> Müll.: percellunt magnas quercus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 194 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">magna Jovis quercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glandiferae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:939" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 939</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 680</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus et ilex Multā fruge pecus juvat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auritae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aridae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durior annosā quercu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:799" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 799</bibl></cit>: quercorum rami, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 717</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n40080.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf. </sense><sense id="n40080.3" n="A" level="2"> ?*!f things made of oak-wood. Of <hi rend="ital">a ship</hi>, of <hi rend="ital">the ship Argo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:65" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 65</bibl>.— Of <hi rend="ital">a javelin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:243" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 243</bibl>.— Of <hi rend="ital">a drinkingvessel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:190" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 190</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Capitolina,</quote> <trans><tr>a garland of oak-leaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:386" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 386</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">usually bestowed upon one who had saved the life of a citizen in battle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:953" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 953</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 563</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 357</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:772" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 772</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40080.4" n="B" level="2"> For <hi rend="ital">acorns</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">veteris fastidia quercūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:184" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 184</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
querela: <entryFree id="n40081" type="main" key="que^re_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĕrēla</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">quĕrella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>queror</etym>, <sense id="n40081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a complaining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complaint</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n40081.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40081.2" n="A" level="2"> Ingen.: <cit><quote lang="la">intervenit nonnullorum querelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum vel admiratio vel querela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inveterata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula plena querelarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:83" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestrum beneficium nonnullam habet querelam,</quote> <trans><tr>gives some occasion for complaint</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his de tot tantisque injuriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:30:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 30, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui sunt inauditae cum Deiotaro querelae tuae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querela Lucretiae patris ac propinquorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:25:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 25, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">QVI VIXIT SINE VLLA QVERELA CVM CONIVGE,</quote> <trans><tr>without any complaint</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 480, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">obj.-gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontis tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querela temporum,</quote> <trans><tr>against the times</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequalium meorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 3, 7</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an quod a sociis eorum non abstinuerim, justam querelam habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 34, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">obj.clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsa est querela, paucissimis hominibus vim percipiendi, quae tradantur, esse concessam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40081.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a complaint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accusation</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">advocati flagitabant, uti judex querelam inspiceret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instituere,</quote> <trans><tr>to institute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:21" default="NO">5, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:10:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 10, 2</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40081.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40081.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A plaintive song</hi> for lulling children to sleep: <cit><quote lang="la">longa somnum suadere querela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:616" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 616</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40081.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A plaintive sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plaintive note</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plaint;</hi> of animals or instruments. — <cit><quote lang="la">Of swans: tollunt lugubri voce querellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 546</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of frogs: et veterem in limo ranae cecinere querellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 378</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 215</bibl>.—Of doves, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 34, 52, § 104</bibl>.— Of the <hi rend="ital">plaintive tones</hi> of the tibia: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcesque querellas, Tibia quas fundit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 584</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1384" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1384</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40081.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A pain that occasions complaining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a complaint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">malady</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmonis ac viscerum querelas levare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 18</bibl> (29), 1.</sense></entryFree>
querelor: <entryFree id="n40082" type="main" key="que^re_lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĕrēlor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n40082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [querela], <hi rend="ital">to make a complaint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de malis praesentibus querelatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> in Psa. 76</bibl></cit>: eum querelantem invenimus, Serv. Argum. ad Bucol. Verg.</sense></entryFree>
querelosus: <entryFree id="n40083" type="main" key="que^re_lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĕrēlōsus</orth>, v. querulosus.</entryFree>
queribundus: <entryFree id="n40084" type="main" key="que^ri^bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĕrĭbundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>queror</etym>, <sense id="n40084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">complaining</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n40084.1" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">totos lustrat queribunda penates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:126" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 126</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40084.2" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">magnā et queribundā voce dicebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:583" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 583</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
querimonia: <entryFree id="n40085" type="main" key="que^ri^mo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĕrĭmōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a complaint</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">querimoniae de injuriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:57:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 57, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novo querimoniae genere uti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>, § 24; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 11, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla inter eos querimonia intercessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 19</bibl></cit>: versibus impariter junctis querimonia primum inclusa est. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">querimonias aut gemitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:26:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 26, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
queritor: <entryFree id="n40086" type="main" key="que^ri^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĕrĭtor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype> (<sense id="n40086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur. part.</hi> queritantūm, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 10, 147</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to complain vehemently</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">queritantibus sociis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:29:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flentes queritantesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
querneus: <entryFree id="n40087" type="main" key="querne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quernĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contr. from quercuneus, quercneus, from quercus</etym>, <sense id="n40087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of oaks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oak-</hi> (ante-class. and postAug.): frondem populneam, ulmeam, querneam<pb n="1510" /> <cb n="QUER" />  caedito, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frutices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 19</bibl></cit> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quernus: <entryFree id="n40088" type="main" key="quernus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quernus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quercus; cf. querneus</etym>, <sense id="n40088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of oaks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oak-</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quernas glandes tum stringere tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:333" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <trans><tr>a garland of oak-leaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
queror: <entryFree id="n40089" type="main" key="que^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĕror</orth>, <itype>questus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n40089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root, c?*!vas-, to sigh</etym>. </sense><sense id="n40089.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40089.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to complain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bewail</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n40089.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: suas fortunas, <hi rend="ital">to bewail one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s fate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum fatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova monstra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 6 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labem atque ignominiam rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40089.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">queritur de Milone per vim expulso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de injuriis alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40089.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quererer tecum, atque expostularem, ni,</quote> <trans><tr>I would complain to you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum patribus conscriptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum deo, quod,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:130:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 130, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecum inconsideratae pietatis queror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:27:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 27, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40089.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">apud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud novercam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud aliquem per litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 13</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quereris patri?</quote> <trans><tr>nor complain to your father?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:131" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 131</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne querantur se relictas esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 14</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatos miserunt Athenas questum, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">queri libet, quod in secreta nostra non inquirant principes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:68:8" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 68, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quereris super hoc, quod non mittam carmina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>. —（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec pro re publicā,</quote> <trans><tr>in behalf of</tr>, <tr>in the name of the State</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:48:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 48, 198</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">i</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi omni tempore, quod mihi lege concessum est, abusus ero, querere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:9:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 9, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non injuste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:40:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 40, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40089.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to make a complaint before a court</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de proconsulatu alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40089.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals and things that utter a plaintive sound. Of apes: <cit><quote lang="la">queri rauco stridore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 100</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of the owl,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 463</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">In gen., of the song of birds,</quote> <trans><tr>to complain</tr>, <tr>lament</tr>, <tr>to coo</tr>, <tr>warble</tr>, <tr>sing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:26" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulce queruntur aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—Of a musical instrument: <cit><quote lang="la">flebile nescio quid queritur lyra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
querquedula: <entryFree id="n40090" type="main" key="querquedu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">querquedŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>from the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kerkouri/s,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=79" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 79</bibl>, acc. to O. Müller's conjecture</etym>, <sense id="n40090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of duck</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the teal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:11:4" default="NO">3, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 1</bibl>: aquatiles querquedulae, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 91, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
querquerus: <entryFree id="n40091" type="main" key="querque^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">querquĕrus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">quercĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">karkai/rw,</foreign> to tremble</etym>, <sense id="n40091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cold to trembling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shivering</hi> (ante- and post-class.): querqueram frigidam cum tremore a Graeco <foreign lang="greek">ka/rkara</foreign> certum est dici, unde et carcer. Lucilius: Jactans me ut febris querquera, <hi rend="ital">the ague</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=256" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 256</bibl> Müll.; so, febris querquera, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 719</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">febris rapida et quercera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:26" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; also, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">querquĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the ague</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">querqueras sanare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 297, 14</bibl> (al. querquerum).</sense></entryFree>
querquetulanus: <entryFree id="n40092" type="main" key="querque_tu^la_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">querquētŭlānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>from querquetum, for quercetum</etym>, <sense id="n40092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an oak-forest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">named from an oakwood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">querquetulanae virae (i. e. virgines) putantur significari nymphae praesidentes querqueto virescenti: quod genus silvae judicant fuisse intra portam, quae ab eo dicta sit Querquetularia. Sed feminas antiqui, quas sciens (scitas?) dicimus, viras appellabant: unde adhuc permanent virgines et viragines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=261" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 261</bibl></cit> Müll.: mons, <hi rend="ital">an earlier name of the</hi> Mons Caelius <hi rend="ital">at Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 65</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">here was querquetulanum sacellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=49" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 49</bibl></cit> Müll.; and: querquetulana porta, <hi rend="ital">a gate in Rome between the</hi> Mons Caelius <hi rend="ital">and</hi> Esquilinus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 15, § 37</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40092.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Quer-quētŭlāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a people of Latium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
querquetularia: <entryFree id="n40093" type="main" key="Querque_tu^la_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Querquētŭlārĭa porta</orth>, v. Querquetulanus <sense id="n40093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
querquetum: <entryFree id="n40094" type="main" key="querque_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">querquētum</orth>, v. quercetum.</entryFree>
querulosus: <entryFree id="n40095" type="main" key="que^ru^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĕrŭlōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quĕrēl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>querulus</etym>, <sense id="n40095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of complaints</hi>, <hi rend="ital">querulous</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">murmuratores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ep. Jud. v. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 9, 14</bibl>. <cb n="QUI" /></sense></entryFree>
querulus: <entryFree id="n40096" type="main" key="que^ru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĕrŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>queror</etym>. <sense id="n40096.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">full of complaints</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complaining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">querulous</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): (senex) difficilis, querulus, laudator temporis acti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ululatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:8:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 308</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:75:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 75, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:5:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libelli rusticorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec querulus essem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:4:9:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 4, 9, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40096.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., of animals and things, <hi rend="ital">softly complaining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uttering a plaintive sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murmuring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cooing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warbling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chirping</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">querulae cicadae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 328</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nidus volucrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:31:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus suis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chorda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 20.</sense></entryFree>
ques: <entryFree id="n40097" type="main" key="ques"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ques</orth>, v. 1. qui <sense id="n40097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quescumque: <entryFree id="n40098" type="main" key="quescumque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quescumque</orth>, v. quicumque <sense id="n40098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quesdam: <entryFree id="n40099" type="main" key="quesdam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quesdam</orth>, v. quidam.</entryFree>
questio: <entryFree id="n40100" type="hapax" key="questi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">questĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>queror</etym>, <sense id="n40100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a complaining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complaint</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habebat enim flebile quiddam in questionibus aptumque ad misericordiam commovendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:38:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 38, 142</bibl></cit> Orell. (B. and K. ex conj. Lambin.: conquestionibus).</sense></entryFree>
questus: <entryFree id="n40101" type="main" key="questus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">questus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from queror.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40102" type="main" key="questus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">questus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>queror</etym>, <sense id="n40102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a complaining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complaint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plaint</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n40102.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40102.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 30, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum questibus implet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantos illa suo rumpebat pectore questus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tales effundit in aëra questus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edere questus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:587" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 587</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in questus effundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creber,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestu vano clamitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40102.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a complaint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accusation</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">questuque Jovem testatur acerbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:624" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 624</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:113" default="NO">1, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 247</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:880" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 880</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40102.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">the soft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plaintive note</hi> of the nightingale: <cit><quote lang="la">maestis late loca questibus implet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 515</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
qui: <entryFree id="n40103" type="main" key="qui1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">qui</orth>, <itype>quae, quod</itype> (old forms: <case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">quei</orth>; <sense id="n40103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> quojus; <case>dat.</case> quoi, and in inscrr. QVOEI, QVOIEI, and QVEI; <case>abl.</case> qui; <number>plur.</number> ques or queis; <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> QVAI; <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> qua; <case>dat.</case> and <case>abl.</case> queis and quĭs.—Joined with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: quocum, quācum, quicum, quibuscum; <cit><quote lang="la">rarely cum quo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>. — Placed also before other prepositions: quas contra, quem propter, etc.; v. h. praepp.), <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40103.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Interrog.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who? which? what? what kind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sort of a?</hi> (adjectively; while quis, quid is used substantively; qui, of persons, asks for the character, quis usu. for the name). </sense><sense id="n40103.2" n="A" level="2"> In direct questions: quae haec daps est? qui festus dies? <hi rend="ital">what sort of a feast? what kind of a festival?</hi> Liv. And. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 752</bibl> P. (a transl. of Hom. Od. 1, 225: <foreign lang="greek">ti/s dai/+s, ti/s de\ o(/milos o(/d) e)/pleto;</foreign> cf. Herm. Doctr. Metr. p. 619): <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Quis fuit igitur? <hi rend="ital">Py.</hi> Iste Chaerea. <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Qui Chaerea? <hi rend="ital">what Chærea?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui color, nitor, vestitus?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cantus dulcior inveniri potest? quod carmen aptius? qui actor in imitandā veritate jucundior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo, quae patria est tua?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occiso Sex. Roscio, qui primus Ameriam nuntiat?</quote> <trans><tr>what sort of a person?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 96</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40103.3" n="B" level="2"> In indirect discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">scribis te velle scire, qui sit rei publicae status,</quote> <trans><tr>what is the state of the country</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cura boum, qui cultus habendo Sit pecori ... Hinc canere incipiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste deus qui sit da, Tityre, nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:608" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 608</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescimus qui sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sit, qui socium fraudarit, consideremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40103.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rel.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which</hi>, <hi rend="ital">what</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, referring to a substantive or pronoun as antecedent. </sense><sense id="n40103.5" n="A" level="2"> As a simple <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40103.6" n="1" level="3"> With antecedent expressed: <cit><quote lang="la">habebat ducem Gabinium, quīcum quidvis rectissime facere posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:19:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 19, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille vir, cui patriae salus dulcior fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir acer, cui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:35:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 35, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir optimus, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Priscus, vir cujus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:46:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 46, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 7, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ego fui ad Trasimenum, id tu hodie es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 30, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collaria, quae vocantur maelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloniam, quam Fregellas appellent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus, quem opobalsamum vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidere, quod Caniculam appellavimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 28, 68, § 272</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40103.7" n="2" level="3"> With pronom. antecedent understood: QVI IN IVS VOCABIT, IVMENTVM DATO, Lex XII. Tabularum: SI ADORAT<cb n="QUI" />  FVRTO, QVOD NEC MANIFESTVM ESCIT, ib. tab. 2, 1. 8: <cit><quote lang="la">novistine hominem? ridicule rogitas, quīcum una cibum capere soleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beati, quīs contigit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac, qui ego sum, esse te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 1</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40103.8" n="3" level="3"> The <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi> freq. agrees with the foll. word: <cit><quote lang="la">est locus in carcere, quod Tullianum appellatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ealoca, quae Numidia appellatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 18, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstat ejus peroratio, qui epilogus dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:33:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 33, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justa gloria, qui est fructus virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:24:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 24, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domicilia conjuncta, quas urbes dicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:42:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 42, 91</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n40103.9" n="4" level="3"> Sometimes it agrees with the logical, not the grammatical antecedent: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tu me arbitrare beluam, qui non novisse possim, quīcum aetatem exegerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi est scelus qui me perdidit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc libro circumcisis rebus, quae non arbitror pertinere ad agriculturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abundantia earum rerum, quae prima mortales ducunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa furia muliebrium relligionum, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: alteram alam mittit, qui satagentibus occurrerent, Auct. B. Afr. 78. — </sense><sense id="n40103.10" n="5" level="3"> Relating to a remote subject: <cit><quote lang="la">annis ferme DX post Romam conditam Livius fabulam dedit ... anno ante natum Ennium: qui (sc. Livius) fuit major natu quam Plautus et Naevius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; v. the commentators ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 26, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:38:10" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 38, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 14, 2</bibl>; cf. Krehl ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 2, 9, § 48, p. 91</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40103.11" n="6" level="3"> The antecedent is sometimes repeated after the <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant itinera duo, quibus itineribus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 6</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40103.12" n="7" level="3"> In a question, with <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> affixed: sed ubi Artotrogus hic est? <hi rend="ital">Art.</hi> Stat propter virum fortem ... <hi rend="ital">Mil.</hi> Quemne ego servavi in campis Curculioniis? <hi rend="ital">whom I saved?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemne ego vidi?</quote> <trans><tr>whom I saw?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40103.13" n="B" level="2"> With an accessory signif., causal or final, joined to the <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40103.14" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">As</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seeing that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">since</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Actio maluimus iter facere pedibus, qui incommodissime navigassemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospes, qui nihil suspicaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:25:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 25, § 64</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ingrata es, ore quae caput nostro Incolume abstuleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 8, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40103.15" n="2" level="3"> Qui, with the <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, also follows dignus, indignus, aptus, idoneus, etc., answering the question, <hi rend="ital">to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for what?</hi> dignus est, qui imperet, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignum esse dicunt, quīcum in tenebris mices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 19, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socios haud indignos judicas, quos in fidem receptos tuearis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idoneus nemo fuit quem imitarere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:16:section=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 16, § 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40103.16" n="3" level="3"> Also after <hi rend="ital">demonstrr.</hi> or clauses expressing or implying <hi rend="ital">a quality</hi> or <hi rend="ital">degree</hi> which is defined or explained in the <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui potest temperantiam laudare is, qui ponat summum bonum in voluptate?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo modo videre potest quicquam esse utile, quod non honestum sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sumus ii, quibus nihil verum esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:5:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc dicis aliquid quod ad rem pertineat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 18, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis potest esse tam mente captus, qui neget?</quote> <trans><tr>as that</tr>, <tr>that</tr>, <tr>to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40103.17" n="4" level="3"> To express <hi rend="ital">a purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">design</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in order that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt autem multi, qui eripiunt aliis, quod aliis largiantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 14, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar equitatum praemisit, qui viderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domi creant decem praetores, qui exercitui praeessent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 4</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40103.18" n="C" level="2"> The <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi> serves as a connective, instead of is, ea, id, with a <hi rend="ital">conj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res loquitur ipsa, quae semper valet plurimum,</quote> <trans><tr>and this</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:20:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 20, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio docet esse deos, quo concesso, confitendum est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:30:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 30, 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40103.19" n="D" level="2"> The <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi> sometimes means, <hi rend="ital">by virtue of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">such</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tua natura est,</quote> <trans><tr>according to your disposition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:78:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 78, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui meus amor in te est,</quote> <trans><tr>such is my love</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40103.20" n="E" level="2"> In <hi rend="ital">neutr. sing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40103.21" n="a" level="4"> Quod signifies, </sense><sense id="n40103.22" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">As much as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as far as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">what</hi>, = quantum: <cit><quote lang="la">adjutabo quod potero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura, quod potes, ut valeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tibi mandavi, velim ut cures, quod sine molestiā tuā facere poteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu tamen, quod poteris, nos consiliis juvabis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; 11, 2, 2; 11, 12, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil cuiquam, quod suum dici vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:16:section=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 16, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Epicurus) se unus, quod sciam, sapientem profiteri est ausus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tuo commodo fiat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: quod litteris exstet, <pb n="1511" /> <cb n="QUI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ad me attinet,</quote> <trans><tr>as far as depends on me</tr>, <tr>for my part</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:42:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 42, 122</bibl></cit>.— With ellips. of <hi rend="ital">attinet</hi>: quod ad Caesarem crebri et non belli de eo rumores, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=57" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 57</bibl> Müll.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod operae,</quote> <trans><tr>so much trouble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod aeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 20</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40103.23" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Wherein</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid est, Quod mea opera opus sit vobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 3, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40103.24" n="b" level="4"> Quo, <hi rend="ital">abl. neutr.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">compp.</hi> (with or without <hi rend="ital">hoc</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eo</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">tanto</hi>): quo ... eo, <hi rend="ital">by how much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by so much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the ... the</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo difficilius, hoc praeclarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 19, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40103.25" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Indef.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, <hi rend="ital">num</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, v. quis: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeritur, num quod officium aliud alio majus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui graviore vulnere accepto equo deciderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi si qui publice ad eam rem constitutus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 26, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(BACANALIA) SEI QVA SVNT, S. C. de Bacchan.: ne qui forte putet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40104" type="main" key="qui_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quī</orth>, <sense id="n40104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv. interrog.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">indef.</hi> [old <case>abl.</case> of 1. qui]. </sense><sense id="n40104.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Interrog.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in what manner? how? whereby? by what means? why?</hi> </sense><sense id="n40104.2" n="A" level="2"> In direct questions: <cit><quote lang="la">quī minus eadem histrioni sit lex quae summo viro?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quī, amabo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quī scire possum?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quī in mentem venit tibi istuc facinus facere?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quī non?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quī vero dupliciter?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quī vero?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quī scis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quī istuc facere potuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quī potui melius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed nos deum nisi sempiternum intellegere quī possumus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:10:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quī potest esse in ejusmodi trunco sapientia?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 30, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quī potest?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quī ego minus in Africam traicerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:43:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 43, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40104.3" n="B" level="2"> In indirect questions: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis demiror, quī illaec me donatum esse aureā paterā sciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quī istuc credam ita esse, mihi dici velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quī hoc mihi eveniat scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque videre, quī conveniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 50</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40104.4" n="C" level="2"> In curses (cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pw=s,</foreign> and Lat. utinam), <hi rend="ital">how</hi>, <hi rend="ital">would that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if but</hi>: quī illum di deaeque magno mactassint malo, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 342, 14</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 377 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">quī te Juppiter dique omnes perduint!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quī istum di perdant!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quī te di omnes perdant!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 155</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 73</bibl>.—Ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">quī illi di irati!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40104.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rel.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wherewith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whereby</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wherefrom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how</hi> (referring to all genders and both numbers). </sense><sense id="n40104.6" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: date ferrum, quī me animā privem, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 474, 30</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 233 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">patera, quī Pterela potitare rex est solitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucophantia, quī admutiletur miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 172</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi dari ... vehicla quī vehar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa concurrunt simul, Quī conjecturam hanc facio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tantā paupertate decessit, ut quī efferretur, vix reliquerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40104.7" n="2" level="3"> Esp., of price, <hi rend="ital">at what price</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for how much</hi>, = quanti: <cit><quote lang="la">indica minumo daturus quī sis, quī duci queat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quī datur, tanti indica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quantum possit quīque liceat veneant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 3, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40104.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in order that: Ca.</hi> Restim volo mihi emere. <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> Quam ob rem? <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> Quī me faciam pensilem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut det, quī fiamus liberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facite, fingite, invenite, efficite, quī detur tibi: Ego id agam, mihi quī ne detur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:34 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 34 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n40104.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Indef.</hi> (only with particles of emphasis and assurance; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pw/s,</foreign> and v. Fleck. Krit. Misc. p. 28; Lorenz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:811" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 811</bibl>; Brix ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 550</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">in some way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somehow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surely</hi> (ante-class.); with <hi rend="ital">hercle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hercle quī, ut tu praedicas, Cavendumst me aps te irato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hercle quī multo improbiores sunt, quam a primo credidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hercle quī aequom postulabat senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 74</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">edepol</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">edepol quī te de isto multi cupiunt nunc mentirier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edepol quī quom hanc magis contemplo, magis placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 144</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">at</hi> (cf. atquī), <hi rend="ital">and yet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but somehow: Gr.</hi> Non audio. <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> At pol quī audies, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 9</bibl>;
