<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 73</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">quippe</hi>: horum tibi istic nihil <cb n="QUIC" /> eveniet, quippe quī ubi quod subripias nihil est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 5, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea nimiast ratio, quippe quī certo scio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe quī Magnarum saepe id remedium aegritudinumst,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 27</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an id est sapere, ut quī beneficium a benevolente repudies?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et eum morbum mi esse, ut quī med opus sit insputarier?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quia: <entryFree id="n40105" type="main" key="qui^a^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭă</orth>, <sense id="n40105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> [for quiam, from <case>abl.</case> quī and jam, whereby now; hence], <hi rend="ital">because</hi> (usually, like quod, of the determining reason; while quonĭam introduces any casual circumstance). </sense><sense id="n40105.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., constr. with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> in asserting a fact; with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> in stating an assumed reason, or one entertained by another mind: <cit><quote lang="la">quia fores nostras ausa es accedere, quiaque istas buccas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs, quae quia postrema aedificata est, Neapolis nominatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quia multis debeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 32, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quia plus animi victis est, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:41:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 41, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam quia pacem volebant Samnites, quam quia nondum parati erant ad bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:13" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 30, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 27, 6</bibl>; 39, 41, 2. — With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil satis est, inquit, quia tantum, quantum habeas, sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:3:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater irata est, quia non redierim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 101</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carent quia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40105.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., with other particles. </sense><sense id="n40105.3" n="A" level="2"> Quiane, in a question, <hi rend="ital">because?</hi> (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <hi rend="ital">Do.</hi> Tu nunc me irrides? <hi rend="ital">Le.</hi> Quiane te voco, bene ut tibi sit? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiane auxilio juvat ante levatos?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 538</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n40105.4" n="B" level="2"> Quia enim, <hi rend="ital">because forsooth</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): quī tibi nunc istuc in mentem venit? <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Quia enim sero advenimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40105.5" n="C" level="2"> Quia nam, and quianam, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ti/ ga/r,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">why? wherefore?</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quianam pro quare et cur positum apud antiquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=257" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 257</bibl></cit> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">Naev. and Enn. ap. Fest. l. l.: quianam arbitrare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: quianam legiones caedimu' ferro? Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A 10, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quianam sententia vobis Versa retro?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 13 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n40105.6" n="III" level="1"> Introducing an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, = quod, <hi rend="ital">that</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">nescitis quia iniqui non possidebunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4 Reg. 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">credo, quia mendacio possunt (animas movere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Idol. 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignoras, quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 9:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non advertentes, quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5:71" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 5, 71</bibl></cit>.—Quia very rarely follows the verb, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quianam: <entryFree id="n40106" type="main" key="qui^a^nam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭănam</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭăne</orth>, v. quia.</entryFree>
quicquam: <entryFree id="n40107" type="main" key="quicquam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quicquam</orth>, v. quisquam.</entryFree>
quicque: <entryFree id="n40108" type="main" key="quicque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quicque</orth>, v. quisque.</entryFree>
quicquid: <entryFree id="n40109" type="main" key="quicquid"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quicquid</orth>, v. quisquis.</entryFree>
quicum: <entryFree id="n40110" type="main" key="qui_cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quīcum</orth>, v. 1. qui <sense id="n40110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quicumque: <entryFree id="n40111" type="main" key="qui_cumque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quīcumque</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-cunque</orth>), <itype>quaecumque, quodcumque</itype> (also separately: <sense id="n40111.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">cum quibus erat cumque una,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">quam se cumque in partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:16:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 16, 59</bibl></cit>. — Old form of the <number>plur.</number> quescumque, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 70</bibl> P., and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 960</bibl> P.), <hi rend="ital">pron. rel.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40111.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Whoever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whatever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whosoever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whatsoever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every one who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every thing that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all that</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quicumque is est, ei me, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>whosoever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 31, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoscumque de te queri audivi, quācumque potui ratione placavi,</quote> <trans><tr>whomsoever I have heard complaining</tr>, <tr>them I have satisfied in every possible way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere fortunam, quaecumque accidat,</quote> <trans><tr>what fortune soever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quodcumque vellet, liceret facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> in orat. rect.: <cit><quote lang="la">quocumque haec modo se habeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 91, § 114</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40111.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (Cic., Cæs., and Sall. always construe quicumque as <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi> with its own verb, except in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.;</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>; as <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> for quivis or quilibet, freq. in Liv. and post-Aug. writers; cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 706), <hi rend="ital">any whatever</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">te audio (libenter) quācumque de re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 8</bibl></cit> (10), 1: <cit><quote lang="la">qui quācumque de causā ad eos venerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quocumque modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 103:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 103, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeti quamcunque condicionem paciscendi acceperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:58:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 58, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubicumque et quācumque matre genitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui de quācumque causā tum aspernati nostra auxilia estis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quācumque condicione arma viris auferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: quocumque gladiatorio munere <cb n="QUID" /> prolapsi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ciceronem cuicunque eorum opponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:105" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 105</bibl></cit>. —In <hi rend="ital">neutr. subst.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whatever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">however much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodcumque est lucri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>all the profit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: quodcumque militum contrahere poteritis, <hi rend="ital">as many troops as ever you can bring together</hi>, Pompon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>, A, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">quodcunque hoc regni,</quote> <trans><tr>all this authority</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 78</bibl></cit>.—When the <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi> occurs twice or oftener in the same connection, only qui is repeated: <cit><quote lang="la">quaecunque navis ex Asiā, quae ex Syriā, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:56:section=145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 56, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quodcumque vides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40111.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., for qualiscumque, <hi rend="ital">howsoever constituted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of whatever kind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaecumque mens illa fuit, Gabinii fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 8, 21</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n40111.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">each</hi> or <hi rend="ital">every possible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sanari poterunt, quācumque ratione sanabo,</quote> <trans><tr>in every possible way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quocumque modo maluit esse mea,</quote> <trans><tr>under all circumstances</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 34</bibl></cit> (1, 8, b, 8): <cit><quote lang="la">de quācumque causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quid: <entryFree id="n40112" type="main" key="quid"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quid</orth>, v. 1. quis.</entryFree>
quidam: <entryFree id="n40113" type="main" key="qui_dam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quīdam</orth>, <itype>quaedam, quoddam</itype>, and <sense id="n40113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> quiddam, <hi rend="ital">pron. indef.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a certain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a certain one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somebody</hi>, <hi rend="ital">something</hi> (v. aliquis <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quidam ex advocatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:63:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 63, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam de collegis nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam certa vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:12:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 12, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopem quendam describere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: quodam tempore, <hi rend="ital">a certain</hi> (indefinite) <hi rend="ital">time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">once upon a time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">once</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 4</bibl>. — In <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">some</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excesserunt urbe quidam, alii mortem sibi consciverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam quaestiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:21:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 21, 79</bibl></cit>.—Also with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam bonorum caesi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibusdam Andriorum persuasit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 45, 7</bibl></cit>.— Often with an <pos>adj.</pos> to soften the assertion: <cit><quote lang="la">timiditate quādam ingenuā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui virtutem duram et quasi ferream quandam esse volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 13, 48</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quiddam</orth>, <hi rend="ital">something;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiddam mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:10:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 10, 23</bibl></cit>. — Without <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiddam divinum,</quote> <trans><tr>something divine</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 9, 33</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam, si credis consultis, mancipat usus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 159</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quidem: <entryFree id="n40114" type="main" key="qui^dem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭdem</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <sense id="n40114.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Indeed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi quidem persuaderi, eum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum doleo, ac mirifice quidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his locis post solstitium Canicula oritur, et quidem aliquot diebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:44:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 44, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40114.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n40114.2" n="1" level="3"> In a confirmation or extension of what precedes, <hi rend="ital">too</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et poscit quidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergam, quo coepi hoc iter, Et quidem ego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod quidem perillustre fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40114.3" n="2" level="3"> In a qualification or opposing thought, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>, <hi rend="ital">however</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utebatur hominibus improbis multis, et quidem optimis se viris deditum esse simulabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">re quidem verā,</quote> <trans><tr>but in fact</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 2, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40114.4" n="C" level="2"> In the phrases, </sense><sense id="n40114.5" n="1" level="3"> Ne ... quidem, <hi rend="ital">not even</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne obsidibus quidem datis pacem redimere potuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 37</bibl></cit> (v. ne).—</sense><sense id="n40114.6" n="2" level="3"> Nec (neque) . . . quidem, <hi rend="ital">and not indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and that not</hi> (very rare, and never <hi rend="ital">ac</hi> or <hi rend="ital">et ne quidem;</hi> v. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:Exc. 111, p. 809" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. Exc. 111, p. 809</bibl> sqq.; R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Lat. Part. p. 46</bibl> sqq.): his litteris animum tuum confirmandum puto; <cit><quote lang="la">nec iis quidem verbis, quibus ... sed ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ejus quidem rei finem video,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nunc quidem viris desidero adulescentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 9, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 55</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40114.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">At least</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in truth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forsooth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum quidem hercle certum promitto tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non video causam, cur ita sit, hoc quidem tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex me quidem nihil audire potuisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:21:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 21, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quidem profecto Romae es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volui id quidem efficere certe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidem certe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 261</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:50:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 50, 4 al.</bibl>— In expressing the utmost indignation, <hi rend="ital">indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">truly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam istaec quidem contumelia est,</quote> <trans><tr>for that is an affront indeed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 82</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40114.8" n="III" level="1"> In introducing an example, <hi rend="ital">for instance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for example</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dicaearchus quidem et Aristoxenus nullum omnino animum esse dixerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:22:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 22, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 33, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 1</bibl></sense></entryFree>
quidnam: <entryFree id="n40115" type="main" key="quidnam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quidnam</orth>, v. quisnam.</entryFree>
quidni: <entryFree id="n40116" type="main" key="quidni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quidni</orth>, v. 1. quis, I. B. <pb n="1512" /> <cb n="QUIE" /></entryFree>
quidpiam: <entryFree id="n40117" type="main" key="quidpiam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quidpiam</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quidquam</orth>, v. quispiam and quisquam.</entryFree>
quidquid: <entryFree id="n40118" type="main" key="quidquid"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quidquid</orth>, v. quisquis.</entryFree>
quidum: <entryFree id="n40119" type="main" key="quidum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quidum</orth>, v. 2. qui, II. B.</entryFree>
quies: <entryFree id="n40120" type="main" key="qui^es1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭes</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype> (<case>abl.</case> quie, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 703</bibl> P.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. çi = jacēre; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kei=mai,</foreign> to lie; cf. Lat. cīvis</etym>, <sense id="n40120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40120.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cessation</hi> from labor, from cares, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">locus quietis et tranquillitatis plenissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem non quies, non remissio delectarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors laborum ac miseriarum quies est,</quote> <trans><tr>a state of rest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex diutino labore quieti se dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quietem capere,</quote> <trans><tr>to take repose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus horis exercitui ad quietem datis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quietem pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 101:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 101, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla metuentibus quies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 13, 11</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti somno et quietibus ceteris,</quote> <trans><tr>recreations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 103</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40120.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40120.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A quiet life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a keeping still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neutrality</hi> between political parties: <cit><quote lang="la">Attici quies tantopere Caesari fuit grata, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40120.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae diuturna quies pepererat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quieti Subdita montanae bracchia Dalmatiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:77" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingrata genti quies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atrox clamor et repente quies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 11</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">si non tanta quies iret frigusque caloremque Inter,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the repose of spring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 62, § 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:26" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenis materiae,</quote> <trans><tr>evenness</tr>, <tr>smoothness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 16, 28, § 70</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40120.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The rest of sleep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sleep</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Cure. 2, 2, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capere quietem,</quote> <trans><tr>to fall asleep</tr>, <tr>go to sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:205" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alta,</quote> <trans><tr>deep sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire ad quietem,</quote> <trans><tr>to go to rest</tr>, <tr>go to sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 29, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quieti se tradere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 29, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum quietem,</quote> <trans><tr>in sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 66, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quietem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque vigiliis neque quietibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 15, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40120.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The sleep of death</hi>, <hi rend="ital">death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">olli dura quies oculos et ferreus urget Somnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:745" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 745</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si forte tibi properarint fata quietem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 28</bibl></cit> (3, 24), 25. — </sense><sense id="n40120.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40120.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A dream</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vanae nec monstra quietis, Nec somno comperta loquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:205" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesaga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 324</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:70:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 70, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducem terruit dira quies, nam Varum cernere visus est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40120.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A resting-place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lair</hi> of a wild beast (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">intectae fronde quietes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 405</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40120.10" n="III" level="1"> Personified: <cit><quote lang="la">Quies,</quote> <trans><tr>the goddess of rest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 41, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:89" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40121" type="main" key="qui^es2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭes</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, for quietus, a, um (cf. inquies), <sense id="n40121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peaceful</hi> (ante-class.): mens, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 704</bibl> P.: milites quietes, Licin. Macer. ib.</sense></entryFree>
quiescentia: <entryFree id="n40122" type="main" key="qui^escenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭescentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>quiesco</etym>, <sense id="n40122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi> (post-class. for quies), Firm. Math. 1, 3.</sense></entryFree>
quiescitus: <entryFree id="n40123" type="gloss" key="qui^esci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭescĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from quiesco; v. quiesco <sense id="n40123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quiesco: <entryFree id="n40124" type="main" key="qui^esco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭesco</orth>, <itype>ēvi, ētum, 3</itype> (the uncontr. <mood>Part.</mood>, QVIESCITA, Inscr. Don. cl. 10, n. 11), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n40124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [quies], <hi rend="ital">to rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep quiet.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40124.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">placida compostus pace quiescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felicius ossa quiescant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:305" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrono meo ossa bene quiescant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam hodie quiescet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">renovat pristina bella, nec potest quiescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:11:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 11, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non somno quiescere,</quote> <trans><tr>to get no rest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non aure quiescit, Non oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:43" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 43</bibl></cit>: quoniam in propriā non pelle quiessem, Hor S. 1, 6, 22.— <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus quidem quam facile potuerat quiesci, si hic quiesset,</quote> <trans><tr>which we might easily have been spared</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 8</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40124.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40124.3" n="1" level="3"> In polit. or milit. affairs, <hi rend="ital">to keep quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain neutral</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abstain from action</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro condicione temporum quieturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quieverant per paucos dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22</bibl></cit> 4, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:8:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 8, 16</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40124.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sleep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quievi in navi noctem perpetem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 10, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo cum venio, praetor quiescebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:14:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 14, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnum humanum quievi,</quote> <trans><tr>I slept like a human being</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 218, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40124.5" n="3" level="3"> Of inanim. things, <hi rend="ital">to rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lie still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be still</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et prato gravia arma quiescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:836" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 836</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <trans><tr>ceases to burn</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiērunt Aequora,</quote> <trans><tr>the waves are at rest</tr>, <tr>do not rise</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 6</bibl></cit>: felicius ossa quiescant, Ov. <cb n="QUIL" /> Ib. 305; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">molliter ossa quiescant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiescentes Nili aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>standing waters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 11, 22, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:22:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 22, 35</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">170: quiescit terra,</quote> <trans><tr>rests</tr>, <tr>lies fallow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 5, 3, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiescunt voces,</quote> <trans><tr>are still</tr>, <tr>silent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40124.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make a pause</hi> in speaking: quiescere, id est, <foreign lang="greek">h(suxa/zein,</foreign> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 93</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40124.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40124.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To suffer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">allow quietly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to peaceably permit</hi> a thing to be done: <cit><quote lang="la">quiescere rem adduci ad interregnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to rest in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be content with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne victos quidem in miserā et inopi senectā quiescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:3:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40124.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desist from</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">quiesce hanc rem modo petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuere atque ediscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:28:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: manibus significare coepit utrisque, quiescerent, Claud. Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">indoctus discive trochive,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 380</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40124.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to cease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">render quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1584" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1584</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">at rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi> (syn. tranquillus). </sense><sense id="n40124.11" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Enjoying rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keeping quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem quietum reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quietus et solutus animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integri, quieti, otiosi homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 28, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo quietissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:19:section=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 19, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de istoc quietus esto,</quote> <trans><tr>be at ease</tr>, <tr>rest contented</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40124.12" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40124.13" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Taking no part in war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peaceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neutral</hi>: ipse acer, bellicosus; <cit><quote lang="la">at is quem petebat, quietus, imbellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoad cum civibus dimicatum est, domi quietus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quietos lacessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:6:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihilo quietiores postea res habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 19</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40124.14" n="b" level="4"> Of the mind, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free from ambition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quam spem (praeturae) quietissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 12</bibl></cit>(7): <cit><quote lang="la">vir rectus, integer, quietus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir ingenio mitis, moribus quietus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:117:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 117, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40124.15" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Tame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gentle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi fiunt quietiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40124.16" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Resting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sleeping</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos simul vescentes dies, simul quietos nox habuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 49</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭēti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">si sentire datur post fata quietis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 1, 38</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40124.17" n="B" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnes,</quote> <trans><tr>gently flowing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quietiore aequore ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">baca,</quote> <trans><tr>that has lain a while</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res publica (opp. perturbata),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 23, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quietus et remissus sermo,</quote> <trans><tr>calm</tr>, <tr>not vehement</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 28</bibl></cit>.— <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n40124.18" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">motionless air</hi>, Petr 131, 9. — </sense><sense id="n40124.19" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Quĭēta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a woman</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s name</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 754, 2</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭētē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">calmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quietly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod aptissimum est ad quiete vivendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiete acta aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 5, 13</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quietius tranquilliusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 12</bibl></cit>: quietius edere (opp. avidius vorare), Macr S. 7, 12, 21.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quietissime se receperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
quietalis: <entryFree id="n40125" type="main" key="qui^e_ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">‡ quĭētālis</orth> <itype>ab antiquis dicebatur orcus</itype>, <sense id="n40125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a resting-place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=257" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 257</bibl> Mull.</sense></entryFree>
quiete: <entryFree id="n40126" type="main" key="qui^e_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭētē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. quiesco, <sense id="n40126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quieto: <entryFree id="n40127" type="main" key="qui^e_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">‡ quĭēto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭētor</orth>, <itype>āri, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n40127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to quiet</hi>, acc. to Priscp. 799 P.</sense></entryFree>
quietorium: <entryFree id="n40128" type="main" key="qui^e_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">‡ quĭētōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>quietus</etym>, <sense id="n40128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a resting-place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tomb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sepulchre</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 810, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quietudo: <entryFree id="n40129" type="gloss" key="qui^e_tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭētūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>quies</etym>, <sense id="n40129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calmness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quietude</hi>: quietudo, <foreign lang="greek">h)remi/a, h(suxi/a,</foreign> Gloss. Cyrill.</sense></entryFree>
quietus: <entryFree id="n40130" type="main" key="qui^e_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. quiesco.</entryFree>
quilibet: <entryFree id="n40131" type="main" key="qui_li^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quī-lĭbet</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-lŭbet</orth>), <itype>quaelibet, quodlibet</itype>, and <sense id="n40131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> quidlibet, <hi rend="ital">pron. indef.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any one who will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any one without distinction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whom you will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">no matter who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the first that comes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all</hi> (class.): quem ament igitur? <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Alium quemlibet, <hi rend="ital">any body else</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any other</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaelibet minima res,</quote> <trans><tr>any the most trifling circumstance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemlubet, modo aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 43, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamlibet in partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <trans><tr>the first name that occurs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quālibet earum rerum possemus unā esse contenti,</quote> <trans><tr>any one alone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibuslibet temporibus,</quote> <trans><tr>at all times</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cb n="QUIN" /> quilibet unus, <hi rend="ital">any one</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quilibet alter agat currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 388</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quidlĭbet</orth>, <hi rend="ital">all and every</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictoribus atque poëtis Quidlibet audendi semper fuit aequa potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 28</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:20:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 20, 45</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40131.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., with an accessory contemptuous signif., <hi rend="ital">the first that comes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">no matter who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut enim histrioni actio, saltatori motus, non quilibet, sed certus quidem est datus: sic vita agenda est certo genere quodam, non quolibet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:34:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 34, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quidlibet ille Garriret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque cum quolibet hoste res fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>with no insignificant enemy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 28, 29, § 104</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">virtutesque non quaslibet faciebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 19, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuria,</quote> <trans><tr>trifling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:8:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quilon: <entryFree id="n40132" type="main" key="quilon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quilon</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cylon</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n40132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">jelly</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">si cylon feceris, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quilon fiat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quimatus: <entryFree id="n40133" type="spur" key="qui^ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭmātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, a false read. for quinquennatus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 178</bibl>.</entryFree>
quin: <entryFree id="n40134" type="main" key="qui_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quīn</orth>, <sense id="n40134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> [<case>abl.</case> quī and ne]. </sense><sense id="n40134.1" n="I" level="1"> As an <hi rend="ital">interrog. particle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">why not? wherefore not?</hi> (only in exhortation or remonstrance; not in inquiring for a fact; cf.: quidni, cur non). </sense><sense id="n40134.2" n="1" level="3"> Usu. with <hi rend="ital">indic. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid stas, lapis? Quin accipis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin experimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit> Fleck. (Umpf experiemur): <cit><quote lang="la">quin continetis vocem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin potius pacem aeternam Exercemus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin igitur ulciscimur Graeciam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:7:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin conscendimus equos?</quote> <trans><tr>why not mount our horses?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40134.3" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">imper.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin me aspice et contempla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin uno verbo dic, quid est, quod me velis,</quote> <trans><tr>just say in one word!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu hoc crimen obice ubi licet agere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>you had better</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 9, 25</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40134.4" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> only in orat. obliq.: <cit><quote lang="la">quin illi congrederentur acie inclinandamque semel fortunae rem darent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:61:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 61, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:43:11" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 43, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 40, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40134.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40134.6" n="A" level="2"> As a <hi rend="ital">rel. particle</hi>, prop. quī or qui ne, and mostly where the <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi> stands for a <hi rend="ital">nom. masc.</hi> or for <hi rend="ital">abl. of time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who ... not</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that not</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>, often = Engl. <hi rend="ital">without</hi> and a <hi rend="ital">participial clause.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40134.7" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">curiosus nemo est quin sit malevolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque aequom est occultum id haberi, quin participem te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla causast quin me condones cruci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nullo modo Introire possem, quin me viderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere non possum, quin ad te mittam,</quote> <trans><tr>I cannot forbear sending to you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum causae nihil esset, quin secus indicaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil abest, quin sim miserrimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem conveni, quin omnes mihi maximas gratias agant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo est, quin ubivis quam ibi ubi est, esse malit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repertus est nemo quin mori diceret satius est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:36:section=88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 36, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo, qui aliquo esset in numero, scripsit orationem quin redigeret omnis sententias, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:61:208" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 61, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil praetermisi, quin enucleate ad te scriberem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ullus flare ventus poterat quin aliquā ex parte secundum cursum haberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli ex itinere excedere licebat quin ab equitatu Caesaris exciperetur,</quote> <trans><tr>without being cut off</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum fere tempus intermiserunt, quin trans Rhenum legatos mitterent,</quote> <trans><tr>without sending</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castello nemo fuit omnino militum quin vulneraretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid recusare potest, quin et socii sibi consulant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 21</bibl></cit>: vix superat, quin triumphus decernatur, <hi rend="ital">it wants little that</hi>, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:13:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 13, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene factum est, quin castra relinquerentur,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>they were very near deserting their camp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:ib. 17:13:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 13, 5</bibl></cit>.— So quin (= quī non) stands for a <hi rend="ital">rel. abl. of time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ullum fere tempus intercessit quin aliquem de motu Gallorum nuntium acciperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 53</bibl></cit>.— More rarely quin stands for quae non, quod non, etc.: nulla est civitas quin ad id tempus partem senatus Cordubam mitteret. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla fuit Thessaliae civitas quin Caesari pareret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla (natura), quin suam vim retineat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:13:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum autem nihil est quin intereat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:12:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 12, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 2</bibl>: nihil est quin male narrando possit depravari, Ter. <pb n="1513" /> <cb n="QUIN" /> Phorm. 4, 4, 16: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tam difficilest quin investigare possiet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Heant. 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum nemo esset, quin hoc se audisse liquido diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:59:section=136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 59, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Messanam nemo venit, quin viderit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">7: nego ullam picturam fuisse, quin inspexerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>, § 1; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:13:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 13, 2 sq.</bibl>, and Cato ap. Gell. ib. § 3.— 2. Esp. after words expressing hesitation (usu. with <hi rend="ital">neg.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">non dubitaturum, quin cederet, Cic Mil. 23, 63: nolite dubitare, quin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:Imp. Pomp. 23:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 23, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et vos non dubitatis, quin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:Agr. 2:26:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 26, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubitatis, Quirites, quin hoc tantum boni in rem publicam conferatis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:Imp. Pomp. 16:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 16, 49</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40134.8" n="3" level="3"> Much more freq. after words expressing doubt, ignorance, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">non dubitabat, quin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave dubites, quin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dubitabat quin ... non posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 11, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:36:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 36, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non esse dubium, quin . . . possent,</quote> <trans><tr>no doubt that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque abest suspicio, quin,</quote> <trans><tr>a suspicion that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis ignerat, quin?</quote> <trans><tr>who is ignorant that? who does not know that?</tr></trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 27, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies fere nullus est, quin hic Satyrus domum meam ventitet,</quote> <trans><tr>hardly a day passes that he does not come</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40134.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That not</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as if not</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as though not</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quin ipse dissentiam, sed quod,</quote> <trans><tr>not but that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: non quin breviter reddi responsum potuerit, Liv 2, 15. — </sense><sense id="n40134.10" n="C" level="2"> For corroboration. </sense><sense id="n40134.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">But</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">really</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of a truth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hercle quin tu recte dicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 77</bibl></cit>: credo; <cit><quote lang="la">neque id injuria: quin Mihi molestum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te nec hortor, nec rogo, ut domum redeas, quin hinc ipse evolare cupio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 30, 1</bibl></cit>.— Esp. in reaching a climax or adding a stronger assertion or proof: quin etiam, <hi rend="ital">yea indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nay even</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">credibile non est, quantum scribam die: quin etiam noctibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 26, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 21, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin etiam necesse crit cupere et optare, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin etiam voces jactare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:768" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 768</bibl></cit>: mortem non esse metuendam, quin etiam si, etc., <hi rend="ital">nay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not even if</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quin et Atridas Priamus fefellit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40134.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Rather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yea rather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ea res animum militaris viri imminuit, quin contra plus spei naotus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40134.13" n="D" level="2"> In corrections, <hi rend="ital">nay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non potest dici satis quantum in illo sceleris fuerit, Quin sic attendite, judices, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:29:78 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 29, 78 sq.</bibl></cit> (cf. Halm ad loc., and Lorenz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 164</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
quinam: <entryFree id="n40135" type="main" key="qui_nam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quī-nam</orth>, <itype>quaenam, quodnam</itype>, <sense id="n40135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron. interrog.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which</hi>, <hi rend="ital">what</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pray</hi> (anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">quinam homo hic ante aedes ejulans conqueritur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: quinam Tantalidarum internecioni modus sit? Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 70</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">quodnam ob facinus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; rarely = uter, <hi rend="ital">which of two?</hi> Hi perpetuas inter se controversias habebant, quinam anteferretur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quinarius: <entryFree id="n40136" type="main" key="qui_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quini</etym>, <sense id="n40136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing five</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quinaria (fistula) dicta a diametro quinque quadrantum,</quote> <trans><tr>a pipe which was five quarter-digits in diameter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 25" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 25</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fistulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 31, § 58</bibl></cit>: quinarius nummus, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, quinarius, <hi rend="ital">a half denarius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">denarii quod denos aeris valebant: quinarii, quod quinos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=173" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 173</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 277</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quincenti: <entryFree id="n40137" type="main" key="quincenti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quincenti</orth>, v. quingenti <sense id="n40137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quinctianus: <entryFree id="n40138" type="main" key="Quincti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quinctĭānus, Quinctĭlĭānus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Quinctīlis</orth>, etc., v. Quint.</entryFree>
quincuncialis: <entryFree id="n40139" type="main" key="quincunci^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quincuncĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quincunx</etym>. <sense id="n40139.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Containing five twelfths</hi> of a whole (of a foot, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">quincuncialis magnitudo,</quote> <trans><tr>the size of five twelfths of a foot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9</bibl></cit>. 48, 72, § <cit><quote lang="la">155: herba,</quote> <trans><tr>five twelfths of a foot high</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 11, 74, § 98</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40139.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">planted in the form of a</hi> quincunx: <cit><quote lang="la">quincuncialis ordinum ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 15, § 78</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quincunx: <entryFree id="n40140" type="main" key="quincunx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quincunx</orth>. <itype>uncis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>quinque-uncia</etym>, <sense id="n40140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fire twelfths</hi> of a whole (of an as, a jugerum, a pound, a sextarius, etc.). </sense><sense id="n40140.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: si de quincunce remota est Uncia, quid superat? <hi rend="ital">from five twelfths of an</hi> as, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 327</bibl>; so <hi rend="ital">five twelfths of a</hi> jugerum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 11</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of a pound</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:28:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 28, 1</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of a</hi> sextarius, <hi rend="ital">five</hi> cyathi. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:28:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 28, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:1:9" default="NO">2, 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quincunces et sex cyathos bessemque bibamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:36:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 36, 7</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">five twelfths of an inheritance</hi>,<cb n="QUIN" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 11, 1</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of interest,</quote> <trans><tr>five per cent</tr>.,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:149" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 149</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In apposition with usura: quincunces usuras spopondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:102" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 102</bibl></cit>; Inscr. Giorn. Arcad. 28, p. 356.— </sense><sense id="n40140.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">trees planted in the form of a</hi> quincunx (i.e. ?*!, the five spots on dice); also, <hi rend="ital">trees planted in oblique lines</hi>, thus: <cit><quote lang="la">?*! quid illo quincunce speciosius, qui in quamcumque partem spectaveris, rectus est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 9</bibl></cit> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">in quincuncem serere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: directi in quincuncem ordines, Cic <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:17:59" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> 17, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quincuncem disposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:15:1" default="NO">3, 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obliquis ordinibus in quincuncem dispositis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quincupedal: <entryFree id="n40141" type="hapax" key="quincu^pe^dal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quincŭpĕdal</orth>, <itype>ālis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>quinque-pes</etym>, <sense id="n40141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a measuring-rod of five feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a five-foot rod</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:92" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 92</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quincuplex: <entryFree id="n40142" type="main" key="quincu_^plex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quincū^plex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quinque-plico</etym>, <sense id="n40142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fivefold</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">cera,</quote> <trans><tr>a writing-tablet consisting of five waxed leaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 4</bibl></cit>: quincuplex Tolosa, <hi rend="ital">consisting of five wards</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quarters</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 24, 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Fl. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quindecies: <entryFree id="n40143" type="main" key="quinde^ci^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quindĕcĭes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-dĕcĭens</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quindecim</etym>, <sense id="n40143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fifteen times</hi>: quindeciens sestertium (<hi rend="ital">neutr. sing.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">fifteen hundred thousand sesterces</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2</bibl>. 25, § 61; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:10:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 10, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
