quindecim: <entryFree id="n40144" type="main" key="quinde^cim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quindĕcim</orth>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>quinque-decem</etym>, <sense id="n40144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fifteen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">QVINDECIM PONDO, Lex XII. Tab.: quindecim miles minas dederat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:70" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies circiter quindecim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 304, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quindecimprimi: <entryFree id="n40145" type="main" key="quinde^cimpri_mi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quindĕcim-prīmi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <sense id="n40145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the board of fifteen chief magistrates</hi> in the municipia, in MSS. abbrev. XV. primi: <cit><quote lang="la">evocat ad se Caesar Massiliensium XV. primos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 35, 1</bibl></cit>; so perh. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 626, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quindecimus: <entryFree id="n40146" type="main" key="quinde^ci^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quindĕcĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quindecim</etym>, <sense id="n40146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fifteenth</hi> (late Lat. for the class. quintus decimus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quindecimvir: <entryFree id="n40147" type="main" key="quinde^cimvir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quindĕcimvir</orth> (<number>plur.</number> in inscrr. usually X[dibreve]V. VIRI, but also written in full, QVINDECIM VIRO SACRIS FACIVNDIS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 476, 7</bibl>, of A. D. 346), vĭri (separated, quindecim Diana preces virorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:70" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 70</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>quindecim-vir</etym>, <sense id="n40147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a member of a college</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commission</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">board of fifteen men</hi> for any official function. — Usually in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quindĕcimvĭri</orth>, <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> ūm and ōrum, <hi rend="ital">the college</hi> or <hi rend="ital">board of fifteen men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fifteen.</hi> So esp., </sense><sense id="n40147.1" n="I" level="1"> In Rome, the quindecimviri Sibyllini or sacris faciundis, <hi rend="ital">a college of priests who had charge of the Sibylline books</hi>, from which, in times of danger, they divined the means of averting the peril by religious rites, Hor. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1100</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2263</bibl> sq.; 2351.— <hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quindecimvirum, Tac. l. l.: quindecemvirum conlegi magister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 3, § 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Cotta quindecimvir sententiam dicturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quindecimvir sacris faciundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 12</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n40147.2" n="II" level="1"> Quindecimviri agris dandis, <hi rend="ital">fifteen commissioners for apportioning lands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 43, 45, § 139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quindecimviralis: <entryFree id="n40148" type="main" key="quinde^cimvi^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quindĕcimvĭrālis</orth> <itype>e</itype> (in inscrr. abbrev. X[dibreve]V. VIRALIS), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the quindecimvirs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">council of fifteen</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotium quindecimviraie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 11</bibl></cit>: SACERDOS (<hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2198</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2199</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2328</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quindecimviratus: <entryFree id="n40149" type="main" key="quinde^cimvi^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quindĕcimvĭrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dignity of a quindecimvir</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the quindecimvirate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quindenarius: <entryFree id="n40150" type="main" key="quinde_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quindēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>quindeni</etym>, <sense id="n40150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing fifteen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Cant. Cantic. 3, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
quindeni: <entryFree id="n40151" type="main" key="quinde_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quindēni</orth>, v. quinideni.</entryFree>
quingenarius: <entryFree id="n40152" type="main" key="quinge_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quingēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quingeni</etym>. <sense id="n40152.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Consisting of five hundred each</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:2:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40152.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Consisting of five hundred</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">thorax,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of five hundred pounds weight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 11, 52, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena,</quote> <trans><tr>a fine of five hundred asses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:14" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 14 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> <cb n="QUIN" /></sense></entryFree>
quingeni: <entryFree id="n40153" type="main" key="quinge_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quingēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n40153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. distr. adj.</hi> [quingenti]. </sense><sense id="n40153.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Five hundred each</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quingenos denarios dat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 16, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:101" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:1:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 1, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40153.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">five hundred</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quingentarius: <entryFree id="n40154" type="main" key="quingenta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quingentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of five hundred</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cohors,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quingenteni: <entryFree id="n40155" type="main" key="quingente_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quingentēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n40155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. distr. adj.</hi> [id.], = quingeni, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 8, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quingentesimus: <entryFree id="n40156" type="main" key="quingente_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quingentēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the five hundredth</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quingenti: <entryFree id="n40157" type="main" key="quingenti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quingenti</orth> (old orthogr. quincenti, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=254" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 254</bibl> Müll.), ae, a (<sense id="n40157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> quingentum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 37, 5</bibl>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quingentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 11</bibl>), <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>quinque-centum</etym>. </sense><sense id="n40157.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Five hundred</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quingentos uno ictu occidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non plus mille quingentum aeris afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">drachmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quingentum milium verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=37" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 37</bibl></cit> Müll.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quingentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:14:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quingentorum milium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 11, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40157.2" n="II" level="1"> Indefinitely, for a great number, <hi rend="ital">five hundred</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 31</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">milia quingenta,</quote> <trans><tr>thousands upon thousands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:95:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 95, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quingenties: <entryFree id="n40158" type="main" key="quingenti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quingentĭes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tĭens</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quingenti</etym>, <sense id="n40158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">five hundred times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quingentiens mille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—Of money: <cit><quote lang="la">quingentiens HS.,</quote> <trans><tr>fifty millions of sesterces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:38:section=93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 38, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miliens et quingentiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:101" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quini: <entryFree id="n40159" type="main" key="qui_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quīni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype> (<sense id="n40159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> quinum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:30" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 30</bibl>; Pandect. 40, 9, 5: quinorum not found), <hi rend="ital">num. distr. adj.</hi> [quinque]. </sense><sense id="n40159.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Five each</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quini in lectulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milia peditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova pariunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aureorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:9:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40159.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">five</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis quinos silet dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 538</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina principum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 26</bibl></cit>.— In <number>sing.</number>: lex me perdit quina vicenaria, i.e. <hi rend="ital">a law invalidating contracts entered into before the age of twenty-five</hi> (the lex Plaetoria; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 15, 61</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrobes non altiores quino semipede,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>two feet and a half</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 16, § 80</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quinideni: <entryFree id="n40160" type="main" key="qui_ni_de_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quīnī-dēni</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">quin-dēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n40160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. distr. adj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40160.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fifteen each</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quina dena jugera agri data in singulos pedites sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quini deni pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quindeni pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">HS.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">menses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:35" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 35</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40160.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">fifteen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quindenis hastis corpus transfigi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quinio: <entryFree id="n40161" type="main" key="qui_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quīnĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>quini</etym>, <sense id="n40161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number five</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pentad</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quinionem filiorum eniti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluminum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 46</bibl></cit>. —Esp. at dice, <hi rend="ital">a five</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cinque</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quiniviceni: <entryFree id="n40162" type="hapax" key="qui_ni_vi_ce_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quīnī-vīcēni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quīnī vīcēni</orth>), <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n40162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. distr. adj.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twenty-five each</hi> (only in Liv.): <cit><quote lang="la">militibus quini viceni denarii dati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
quinquagenarius: <entryFree id="n40163" type="main" key="quinqua_ge_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquāgēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quinquageni</etym>. <sense id="n40163.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Consisting of fifty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">containing fifty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">grex equarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 69, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula,</quote> <trans><tr>the plate of which</tr>, <tr>before being bent</tr>, <tr>was fifty inches in width</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinquagenarius (homo),</quote> <trans><tr>fifty years old</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40163.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquāgēnārĭi</orth>, <itype>among the Israelites</itype>, <hi rend="ital">military officers commanding fifty men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">captains over fifty</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 2, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:18:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 18, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Reg. 1, 9</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
quinquageni: <entryFree id="n40164" type="main" key="quinqua_ge_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquāgēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype> (<sense id="n40164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> quinquagenūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:99 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 24, 28, § 99 al.</bibl>: quinquagenorum not found), <hi rend="ital">num. distr. adj.</hi> [quinquaginta]. </sense><sense id="n40164.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fifty each</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in singulos HS. quinquagenis milibus damnari mavultis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:28:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 28, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 5</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">centena quinquagena fruge fertilis campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 5, 3, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinquageno filo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40164.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">fifty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quinquagenas brumas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 3, 603</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:66:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 66, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quinquagensiens: <entryFree id="n40165" type="hapax" key="quinqua_gensi^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquāgensĭens</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fifty times</hi> (for the usual quinquagiens), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 99</bibl> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quinquagesimus: <entryFree id="n40166" type="main" key="quinqua_ge_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquāgēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <pb n="1514" /> <cb n="QUIN" /> [quinquaginta]. <sense id="n40166.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The fiftieth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anno trecentesimo et quinquagesimo fere post Romam conditam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 35, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinquagesimo uno raptus anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 8, 6, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:24:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 24, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40166.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquāgēsĭma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. pars), <hi rend="ital">a fiftieth part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fiftieth</hi>, as a tax: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omnibus enim ternae praeterea quinquagesimae exigebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:49:section=116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 49, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">binae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 78</bibl></cit>, § 181.</sense></entryFree>
quinquagiens: <entryFree id="n40167" type="main" key="quinqua_gi^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquāgĭens</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fifty times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 25, 25, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centena milia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 9, 10, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfricare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quinquaginta: <entryFree id="n40168" type="main" key="quinqua_ginta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquāginta</orth>, <pos>num. adj.</pos>, <sense id="n40168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fifty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinquaginta et quattuor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 703</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 280, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:23:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 23, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quinquangulus: <entryFree id="n40169" type="main" key="quinquangu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquangŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quinque-angulus</etym>, <sense id="n40169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">five-cornered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quinquangular</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Pond. p. 1358</bibl> P.; Boëth. Geom. p. 398, 8 and 10.</sense></entryFree>
quinquatrus: <entryFree id="n40170" type="main" key="Quinqua_tru_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quinquātrūs</orth>, <itype>ŭum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Quin-quātrĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum and ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>quinque, as falling on the fifth day after the ides; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 14</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=254 sq" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 254 sq.</bibl> ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:21:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 21, 7</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n40170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a festival celebrated in honor of Minerva</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the festival of Minerva</hi> (of these there were two, the greater, majores, held from the 19th to the 23d of March; and the lesser, minores or minusculae, on the 13th of June): Quinquatrus, hic dies unus, a nominis errore observatur proinde ac sint quinque. Dictus ut ab Tusculanis post diem sextum Idus similiter vocatur Sexatrus, et post diem septimum Septimatrus; <cit><quote lang="la">sic hic, quod erat post diem quintum Idus Quinquatrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 14</bibl></cit> Müll. This is described by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:809" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 809</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quinquatribus frequenti senatu causam tuam egi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pridie Quinquatrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quinquatribus ultimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 197</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In the form Quinquatria: celebrabat et in Albano quotannis Quinquatria Minervae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollemnia Quinquatrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>: nos Quinquatriis satis jucunde egimus, August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 65</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of the lesser Quinquatrus: Quinquatrus minusculae dictae Juniae Idus ab similitudine majorum, quod tibicines tum feriati vagantur per urbem et conveniunt ad aedem Minervae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 17</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=149" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 149</bibl> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">et jam Quinquatrus jubeor narrare minores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:651" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 651</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quinque: <entryFree id="n40171" type="main" key="quinque1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinque</orth>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pe/nte;</foreign> Sanscr. pancan; Germ. fünf; Engl. five</etym>, <sense id="n40171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">five</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 626</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinque tenent caelum zonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 233</bibl></cit>. pueri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">talenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinque ter ulnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:749" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 749</bibl></cit>: VIGINTI QVINQVE AERIS POENAE SVNTO, Lex XII. Tabularum, tab. 6.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40172" type="main" key="quinque2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinque</orth>, <itype>for et quin</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 70</bibl>.</entryFree>
quinquefolius: <entryFree id="n40173" type="main" key="quinque^fo^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĕfŏlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quinquefolium</etym>. <sense id="n40173.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Five-leaved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40173.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĕfŏlĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cinque-foil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 62, § 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quinquegentiani: <entryFree id="n40174" type="main" key="Quinque^genti^a_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quinquĕgentĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>quinque-gens</etym>, <sense id="n40174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Cyrenaica</hi> (Latinized for Pentapolitani), <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 22</bibl>.— As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quinquegentianae nationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 39" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quinquegenus: <entryFree id="n40175" type="main" key="quinque^ge^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĕgĕnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quinquegenus</etym>, <sense id="n40175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of five kinds</hi> (post-class.): nux, Aus. ldyll. 12 in Monosyll. de Cibis, 10.</sense></entryFree>
quinquejugus: <entryFree id="n40176" type="main" key="quinque^ju^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĕjŭgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quinquejugum</etym>, <sense id="n40176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having five summits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">five-peaked</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vertex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1:18" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quinquelibralis: <entryFree id="n40177" type="main" key="quinque^libra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĕlibrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quinque-libra</etym>, <sense id="n40177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of five pounds</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pondus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:15:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 15, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quinquelibris: <entryFree id="n40178" type="main" key="quinque^libris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĕ-libris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of five pounds weight</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">patera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quinquemestris: <entryFree id="n40179" type="main" key="quinque^mestris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĕmestris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quinquemensis</etym>, <sense id="n40179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of five months</hi>, <hi rend="ital">five months old</hi> (anteclass. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 75, § 198</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quinquennalicius: <entryFree id="n40180" type="gloss" key="quinquenna_li_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquennālīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quinquennalis</etym>, <sense id="n40180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">who has been a quinquennal</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3720</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3721</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3890</bibl>. <cb n="QUIN" /></sense></entryFree>
quinquennalis: <entryFree id="n40181" type="main" key="quinquenna_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquennālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quinquennis</etym>. <sense id="n40181.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That takes place every fifth year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quinquennial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinquennalis celebritas ludorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 32, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludicrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 4, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40181.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquennālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">games celebrated every fifth year</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">NERONIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 116, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40181.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Continuing five years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quinquennial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">censura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratus quinquennalis,</quote> <trans><tr>the office of a quinquennal</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 247, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. quinquennalitas.— </sense><sense id="n40181.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquennā-lis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a magistrate in the municipal towns who held his office five years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quinquennal</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decurionum quinquennales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 273</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 19</bibl>; Cod. Th. 13, 3, 1.</sense></entryFree>
quinquennalitas: <entryFree id="n40182" type="gloss" key="quinquenna_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquennālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>quinquennalis, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n40182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office and dignity of a quinquennal</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4075</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6029</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quinquennatus: <entryFree id="n40183" type="hapax" key="quinquenna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquennātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>quinqueannus</etym>, <sense id="n40183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the age of five years</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">robur in quinquennatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 178</bibl></cit> Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quinquennis: <entryFree id="n40184" type="main" key="quinquennis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquennis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of five years</hi> or <hi rend="ital">five years old</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympias,</quote> <trans><tr>celebrated every fifth year</tr>, <tr>quinquennial</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:6:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 6</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquennĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, for <orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquennālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <hi rend="ital">games celebrated every fifth year</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:113" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quinquennium: <entryFree id="n40185" type="main" key="quinquenni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquennĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>quinquennis</etym>, <sense id="n40185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a period of five years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">five years</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">CENSORES MAGISTRATVM QVINQVENNIVM HABENTO,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tria quinquennia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>fifteen years</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:584" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 584</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quinquepartito: <entryFree id="n40186" type="main" key="quinque^parti_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĕpartītō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. quinquepartitus <sense id="n40186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quinquepartitus: <entryFree id="n40187" type="main" key="quinque^parti_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĕ-partītus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-pertītus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>partio</etym>, <sense id="n40187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">divided into five parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fivefold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quinquepartite</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">argumentatio (al. quinquepertita),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:34:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 34, 59</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĕpartītō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a fivefold manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fivefold</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 29, § 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quinquepedal: <entryFree id="n40188" type="main" key="quinque^pe^dal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĕpĕdal</orth>, <itype>ālis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>quinquepedalis</etym>, <sense id="n40188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a five-foot measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rod five feet long</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:92" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 92</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quinquepedalis: <entryFree id="n40189" type="main" key="quinque^pe^da_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĕ-pĕdālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n40189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of five feet</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">terminus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Limit. p. 212" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Limit. p. 212</bibl></cit> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
quinqueplex: <entryFree id="n40190" type="gloss" key="quinqueplex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinqueplex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quinqueplico</etym>, for quincuplex, <sense id="n40190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fivefold</hi>: quinqueplex, <foreign lang="greek">penta/plous,</foreign> Gloss. Vet.</sense></entryFree>
quinqueplico: <entryFree id="n40191" type="main" key="quinquepli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinqueplĭco</orth>, v. quinquiplico.</entryFree>
quinqueplum: <entryFree id="n40192" type="gloss" key="quinqueplum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinqueplum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n40192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a quintuple</hi>: quinqueplum, <foreign lang="greek">penta/ploun,</foreign> Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
quinqueprimi: <entryFree id="n40193" type="main" key="quinque^pri_mi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĕ-prīmi</orth> (and separated, <orth extent="full" lang="la">quinque prīmi</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n40193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the five principal men in a city</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after the magistracy in the colonies and</hi> municipia; transl. of <foreign lang="greek">penta/prwtoi</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratus et quinqueprimi evocantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:28:section=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 28, § 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quinqueremis: <entryFree id="n40194" type="main" key="quinque^re_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĕrēmis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quinque-remus</etym>: <sense id="n40194.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">decem quinqueremes naves,</quote> <trans><tr>having five banks of oars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĕrēmis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a ship</hi> or <hi rend="ital">galley having five banks of oars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quinquereme</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in quinqueremi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:46:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 46, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:12" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 208</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quinqueres: <entryFree id="n40195" type="gloss" key="quinque_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquēres</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vox hibr., from quinque-<foreign lang="greek">e)re/ssw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n40195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel having five banks of oars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quinquereme</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bieris, trieris, quatrieris, quinqueris, hexeris, hepteris, penteris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 177</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quinquertio: <entryFree id="n40196" type="main" key="quinquerti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquertĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. quinquertium.</entryFree>
quinquertium: <entryFree id="n40197" type="main" key="quinquerti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquertĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>quinque-ars</etym>, <sense id="n40197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the five sorts of bodily exercises for youth</hi> (discus, cursus, saltus, lucta, jaculatio): quinquertium vocabant antiqui, quem Graeci <foreign lang="greek">pe/ntaqlon</foreign> . . . Livius quoque (Andron.) ipsos athletas sic nominat: <cit><quote lang="la">quinquertiones praeco in medium vocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=257" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 257</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=256" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 256</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
quinquessis: <entryFree id="n40198" type="main" key="quinquessis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquessis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>quinque-as</etym>, <sense id="n40198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">five</hi> asses (post-class.): sed tum quinarius quinquessis valebat, App. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 708</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
quinquevertex: <entryFree id="n40199" type="main" key="quinque^vertex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĕ-vertex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n40199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having five summits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">five-peaked</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1:29" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1, 29</bibl></cit>. <cb n="QUIN" /></sense></entryFree>
quinquevir: <entryFree id="n40200" type="main" key="quinque^vir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĕvir</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">V</orth>.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, usu. in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĕ-vĭri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vir</etym>, <sense id="n40200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">board of five</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the quinquevirs</hi>, a board or commission of five men for any official function. Thus, <hi rend="ital">five commissioners</hi>, </sense><sense id="n40200.1" n="1" level="3"> For the apportionment of lands, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 7, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinqueviros Pomptino agro dividendo creaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 21, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40200.2" n="2" level="3"> For regulating indebtedness (quinqueviri mensarii), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 21, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40200.3" n="3" level="3"> For repairing walls and towers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 7, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40200.4" n="4" level="3"> As assistants to the tresviri for the watch by night, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=31 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 31 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n40200.5" n="5" level="3"> Under the emperors, <hi rend="ital">a commission to control the public expenditures</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegium quinquevirorum publicis sumptibus minuendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.— In <number>sing.</number>, <hi rend="ital">a member of the board of five</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quinquevir</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinquevir,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 44, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriba ex quinqueviro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quinqueviralicius: <entryFree id="n40201" type="gloss" key="quinque^vi^ra_li_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĕvĭrālīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quinqueviri</etym>, <sense id="n40201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the quinquevirs</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 395</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quinqueviralis: <entryFree id="n40202" type="main" key="quinque^vi^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĕvĭrālis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">V</orth>.), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to the quinquevirs</hi>, Cod. Th. 9, 1, 13; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 4, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quinqueviratus: <entryFree id="n40203" type="main" key="quinque^vi^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĕvĭrātus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">V</orth>.), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dignity of a quinquevir</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the quinquevirate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinqueviratum accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 17, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quinquiens: <entryFree id="n40204" type="main" key="quinqui^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĭens</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quinque</etym>, <sense id="n40204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">five times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinquiens quinque numerare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absolutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinquiens miliens,</quote> <trans><tr>five thousand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 23, 21, § 85</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quinquifidus: <entryFree id="n40205" type="main" key="quinqui^fi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĭfĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quinquefindo</etym>, <sense id="n40205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">five-cleft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quinquifid</hi> (post-class.): tela, Ven. 5, 6 praef.</sense></entryFree>
quinquiplico: <entryFree id="n40206" type="hapax" key="quinqui^pli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquĭplĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>quinqueplico</etym>, <sense id="n40206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make fivefold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to quintuplicate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>‡ * <orth extent="full" lang="la">quinquo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to expiate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purify by religious rites</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinquatrus a quinquando, id est lustrando,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 62</bibl></cit> P. dub.</sense></entryFree>
quintadecimani: <entryFree id="n40207" type="main" key="quinta^de^ci^ma_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quintădĕcĭmāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>quintusdecimus</etym>, <sense id="n40207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the soldiers of the fifteenth legion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the men of the fifteenth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quintanus: <entryFree id="n40208" type="main" key="quinta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quintānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quintus</etym>, <sense id="n40208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the fifth</hi>, viz., </sense><sense id="n40208.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the fifth rank</hi> or <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fifth in order</hi>: nonae quintanae dicuntur, quae quinto mensis die veniunt: sicut septimanae, quae septimo, <hi rend="ital">that fall on the fifth day of the month</hi> (but septimana, that fall on the seventh), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=27" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 27</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineas semper quintanis seminari (sc. vicibus),</quote> <trans><tr>at every fifth stake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 169</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40208.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quintāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. via), <hi rend="ital">a street in the camp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which intersected the tents of the two legions in such a manner as to separate the fifth</hi> maniple <hi rend="ital">from the sixth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the fifth</hi> turma <hi rend="ital">from the sixth.</hi> Here was the market and businessplace of the camp: quintana appellatur porta in castris post praetorium, ubi rerum utensilium forum sit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=256" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 256</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quaestorium forum quintanamque hostes pervenerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Hence, transf.: quintana domi constituta,</quote> <trans><tr>a market</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40208.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the fifth legion;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quin-tāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the soldiers of the fifth legion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quintarius: <entryFree id="n40209" type="main" key="quinta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quintārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to five</hi>, <hi rend="ital">containing five</hi>: quintarius numerus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">five sixths</hi>, taking the number six as a whole, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1</bibl>: limes, <hi rend="ital">that encloses five</hi> centuriae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Limit. p. 158" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Limit. p. 158</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
quintianus: <entryFree id="n40210" type="main" key="Quinti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quintĭānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Quinct-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Quintius, B.</entryFree>
quinticeps: <entryFree id="n40211" type="gloss" key="quinti^ceps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quintĭceps</orth>, <itype>cĭpĭtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n40211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having five peaks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">five-peaked</hi>: Cespius mons quinticeps, an ancient formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5</bibl>, §§ 50, 52, and 54 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
quintilianus: <entryFree id="n40212" type="main" key="Quinti^li^a_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quintĭlĭānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Quinct-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n40212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Quintilian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman surname.</hi> Thus, M. Fabius Quintilianus, <hi rend="ital">the celebrated rhetorician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teacher of Pliny the younger and Juvenal; a native of Calagurris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Spain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose rhetorical work</hi>, De Institutione Oratoriā, <hi rend="ital">is still extant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:90:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 90, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 14, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:75" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 75</bibl> and 280; 7, 180.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n40213" type="main" key="Quinti^li^a_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quintĭlĭānus</orth>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Quintilius, II. <pb n="1515" /> <cb n="QUIP" /></entryFree>
quintilis: <entryFree id="n40214" type="main" key="Quinti_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quintīlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Quinct-</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, with and without <sense id="n40214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mensis</hi> [quintus], <hi rend="ital">the fifth month</hi> (counting from March), afterwards, in honor of Julius Cæsar, called Julius, <hi rend="ital">July</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 34</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">mense Quintili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idibus Quintilibus,</quote> <trans><tr>on the ides of July</tr>, <tr>the fifteenth of July</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quintilius: <entryFree id="n40215" type="main" key="Quinti^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quintĭlĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Quinct-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Quin-tĭlĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Quinct-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n40215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. Thus, </sense><sense id="n40215.1" n="1" level="3"> Quintilius Varus, <hi rend="ital">proconsul of Syria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards commander of the Romans in Germany</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defeated by Arminius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:117:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 117, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40215.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A poet of Cremona</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Horace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and kinsman of Virgil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 24, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 438</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40215.3" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi> Quintilia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:96:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 96, 7</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n40215.4" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Quintĭ-lĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, of or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Quintilius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Quintilian</hi>: Luperci, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. faviani, p. 87 Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:ib. 257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 257</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quintipor: <entryFree id="n40216" type="main" key="Quinti^por"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quintĭpor</orth>, <itype>pŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Quintus-puer</etym>, <sense id="n40216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name for slaves</hi>, of frequent occurrence, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 448, 15</bibl>; cf. Marcipor and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=257" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 257</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
quintius: <entryFree id="n40217" type="main" key="Quinti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quintĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Quinct-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n40217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. Thus, </sense><sense id="n40217.1" n="1" level="3"> L. Quintius Cincinnatus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26:8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26, 8 sq.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n40217.2" n="2" level="3"> T. Quintius Flaminius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 10, 7</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n40217.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Quintĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Quinct-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Quintius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Quintian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Quintiā gente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit>: prata, <hi rend="ital">at Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beyond the Tiber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">named after</hi> L. Quintius Cincinnatus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4, 7</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=256" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 256</bibl> Müll.— </sense><sense id="n40217.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Quintĭānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Quinct-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Quintius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Quintian</hi>: Quintianus exercitus, <hi rend="ital">commanded by</hi> L. Quintius Cincinnatus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:41:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 41, 113</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quinto: <entryFree id="n40218" type="main" key="quinto_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quintō</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">quintum</orth>, <sense id="n40218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. 1. quintus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quintuplex: <entryFree id="n40219" type="main" key="quintuplex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quintuplex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quintus-plico</etym>, <sense id="n40219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fivefold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quintuple</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">salarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quintuplico: <entryFree id="n40220" type="main" key="quintupli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quintuplĭco</orth>, v. quinquiplico.</entryFree>
quintus: <entryFree id="n40221" type="main" key="quintus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quintus</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">quinctus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 123</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>quinque</etym>, <sense id="n40221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fifth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarta invidia, quinta ambitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:53:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 53, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 55, 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinta pars,</quote> <trans><tr>quintessence</tr>, <tr>essence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinto mense, quinto die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 7</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40221.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">quintum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">for the fifth time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">declarati consules Q. Fabius Maximus quintum, Q. Fabius Flaccus quartum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14, 6</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40221.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">quintō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">for the fifth time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem anno lectisternium Romae, quinto post conditam Urbem, habitum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40222" type="main" key="Quintus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quintus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Quinta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n40222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Roman prænomen;</hi> the former usually abbreviated Q.: <cit><quote lang="la">Quintus Arrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 17, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Scaevola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 10, 31</bibl></cit>.—Quinta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 14, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:13:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 13, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 14, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quintusdecimus: <entryFree id="n40223" type="main" key="quintusde^ci^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quintus-dĕcĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>num. adj.</pos>, <sense id="n40223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fifteenth</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:54:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 54, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quintisdecimis castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in libro quintodecimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:16:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 16, 11</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">often separately: quinto decimo Kal. Dec.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:88" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 88</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and sometimes in reverse order: anno decimo quinto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quinus: <entryFree id="n40224" type="main" key="qui_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. quini, II.</entryFree>
quippe: <entryFree id="n40225" type="main" key="quippe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quippe</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> and <sense id="n40225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> [quī-pe], a particle of corroboration, similar to nempe (from nam-pe), <hi rend="ital">surely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be sure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by all means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in fact.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40225.1" n="1" level="3"> Recte igitur diceres te restituisse? Quippe: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim facilius est quam probari iis, qui? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:19:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 19, 55</bibl></cit>: leve nomen habet utraque res: quippe; <cit><quote lang="la">leve enim est hoc totum, risum movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 219</bibl></cit>: a te quidem apte (dictum est); quippe; <cit><quote lang="la">habes enim a rhetoribus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—Ironically, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forsooth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe, vetor fatis,</quote> <trans><tr>I</tr>, <tr>forsooth</tr>, <tr>am forbidden by the fates!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">movet me quippe lumen curiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 12, 33</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40225.2" n="2" level="3"> Introducing an explanation, <hi rend="ital">for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for in fact</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe benignus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe color nivis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:852" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 852</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 495</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe homo jam grandior Se continebat ruri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam contra miseriti, periturae quippe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—So parenthet.: non illi <cb n="QUIR" /> contempsere, quippe toties fusi fugatique ... se et vos novere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:8 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 4, 8 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n40225.3" n="3" level="3"> Hence, introducing a fact given as a reason or cause, = nam, enim, <hi rend="ital">for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inasmuch as</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">quippe si hercle rescivere inimici consilium tuom, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellego aequos bonosque mihi favere, quippe beneficia mea rei publicae procedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo exercitus periculi magis praesentis quam curae expertes, quippe imperium agebatur in tam paucorum virtute positum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40225.4" n="4" level="3"> In connection with the causal particles, <hi rend="ital">enim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">etenim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quia</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">for indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">since in fact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inasmuch as</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 617</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe etenim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insanabilis non est credendus, quippe quoniam in multis sponte desiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 64, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe quando mihi nihil credis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 106</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq.: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe cum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: neque Cimoni fuit turpe, sororem habere in matrimonio, quippe cum cives ejus eodem uterentur instituto, Nep. praef. § 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 39, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe ubi dimidiae partis pars semper habebit Dimidiam partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 617</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:990" default="NO" valid="yes">990</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 661</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40225.5" n="5" level="3"> In connection with the relative pronouns, <hi rend="ital">qui</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quae</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>, prop., <hi rend="ital">as one in fact who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">since</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inasmuch as I</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thou</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n40225.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>: dicat, argenti minas se habere quinquaginta: quippe ego qui nudiustertius meis manibus dinumeravi, <hi rend="ital">since</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seeing that I paid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 30</bibl>: tametsi pro imperio vobis quod dictum foret, Scibat facturos; quippe qui intellexerat, Vereri vos se et metuere, <hi rend="ital">since he knew that you revered</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. prol. 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperite januam hanc Orci: nam equidem haud aliter esse duco: quippe quo nemo advenit, nisi quem spes reliquere omnes,</quote> <trans><tr>since no one comes here</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa de meā sententiā questus est Caesar, quippe quod etiam Ravennae Crassum ante vidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimum terroris Romam celeritas hostium tulit, quippe quibus aegre ad undecimum lapidem occursum est,</quote> <trans><tr>and in fact they met them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 37</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40225.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">convivia cum patre non inibat: quippe qui ne in oppidum quidem, nisi perraro, veniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc.
