Am. 18, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil attinet eam ex lege considerare, quippe quae in lege scripta non sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:45:131" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 45, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum a tyranno crudeliter violatus esset, quippe quem venundari jussisset: tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40225.8" n="6" level="3"> In connection with <hi rend="ital">etiam</hi> and <hi rend="ital">et</hi>, <hi rend="ital">since indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for even</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quippe etiam festis quaedam exercere diebus, Fas et jura sinunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe et Collinas ad fossam moverit herbas, Stantia currenti diluerentur aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 11.—</sense><sense id="n40225.9" n="7" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so that</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:3:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quippiam: <entryFree id="n40226" type="main" key="quippi^am"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quippĭam</orth>, v. quispiam.</entryFree>
quippini: <entryFree id="n40227" type="main" key="quippi^ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quippĭ-ni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quippĕni</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quippeni</etym>, <sense id="n40227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">why not?</hi> or, affirmatively, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be sure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by all means</hi> (ante- and post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 229, 15</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Chr.</hi> Quid? illam meretricemne esse censes? <hi rend="ital">Ni.</hi> Quippeni? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quiqui: <entryFree id="n40228" type="main" key="qui_qui"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quī-qui</orth>, <sense id="n40228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron. indef.</hi>, for quisquis, <hi rend="ital">whosoever</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quiqui est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quiriana: <entryFree id="n40229" type="main" key="Qui^ri^a_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quĭrĭāna māla</orth>, v. Quiriniana.</entryFree>
quirina: <entryFree id="n40230" type="main" key="Qui^ri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quĭrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n40230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman tribe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quirina tribus a Curensibus Sabinis appellationem videtur traxisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=254" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 254</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 5</bibl> and 6; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 56, 11</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
quirinalis: <entryFree id="n40231" type="main" key="Qui^ri_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quĭrīnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (<case>abl.</case> QVIRINALE, Kalend. in lnscr. Orell. 2, p. 396), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Quirinus</etym>. <sense id="n40231.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Quirinus</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Romulus</hi>), <hi rend="ital">Quirinal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quirinalis flamen,</quote> <trans><tr>priest of Romulus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 45</bibl></cit> Müll.: lituus, <hi rend="ital">such as Romulus bore</hi> (an historical prolepsis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 187</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 612</bibl></cit>: collis Quirinalis, <hi rend="ital">the Quirinal Hill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Quirinal</hi>, one of the seven hills of Rome, now <hi rend="ital">Monte Cavallo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis Quirinalis ob Quirini fanum: sunt qui a Quiritibus, qui cum T. Tatio Curibus venerunt Romam, quod ibi habuerunt castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=51" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 51</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: Quirinalis collis qui nunc dicitur, olim Agonus appellabatur, ante quam in eum commigrarent fere Sabini Curibus venientes, post foedus inter Romulum et Tatium <cb n="QUIR" /> ictum: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo hanc appellationem sortitus est: quamvis existiment quidam quod in eo factum sit templum Quirino, ita dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=254" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 254</bibl></cit> Müll.; and: <cit><quote lang="la">templa Deo (Quirino) fiunt: collis quoque dictus ab illo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:511" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 511</bibl></cit>: collis Quirinalis terticeps cis aedem Quirini, an ancient formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=51" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 51</bibl> Müll.; also, <cit><quote lang="la">Quirinale jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:218" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 218</bibl></cit>: Quirinalis porta dicta sive quod ea in collem Quirinalem itur, seu quod proxime eam est Quirini sacellum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=255" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 255</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n40231.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Quĭrīnā-lĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival in honor of Romulus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated annually on the</hi> 17<hi rend="ital">th of February</hi> (XIII. Cal. Mart.), <hi rend="ital">the Quirinal festival</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 13, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quiriniana: <entryFree id="n40232" type="main" key="Qui^ri_ni^a_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quĭrīnĭāna</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Quĭrĭāna māla</orth>, <sense id="n40232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of apple</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 15, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quirinus: <entryFree id="n40233" type="main" key="Qui^ri_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quĭrīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>from Quiris for Cures, a Sabine town; <cit><quote lang="la">falsely derived from curim, a Sabine word, = hasta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 9, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:475" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 475</bibl> sqq., or from curia, Corss. Ausspr. 2, p. 357 sq.</etym>, <sense id="n40233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40233.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of Romulus</hi>, after his deification: Quirine pater, veneror, Horamque Quirini, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 120, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 121 Vahl.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:22:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 22, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertia (lux) dicta Quirino. Qui tenet hoc nomen, Romulus ante fuit. Sive quod hasta curis priscis est dicta Sabinis (Bellicus a telo venit in astra Deus): Sive suum regi nomen posuere Quirites: Seu quia Romanis junxerat ille Cures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:475" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 475</bibl></cit> sqq.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 10, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duos flamines adjecit. Marti unum, alterum Quirino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Remo cum fratre Quirinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 292</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, populus Quirini,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Romans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs Quirini,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:8:37" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 8, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba Quirini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 607</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gemini Quirini,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Romulus and Remus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:105" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 105</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40233.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of Janus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Janum Quirinum semel atque iterum a conditā Urbe clausum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the temple of Janus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> in Monum. Ancyr. Macr. S. 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 7, 610</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Janus Quirini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 9</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40233.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of Augustus</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40233.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of Antony</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">altera classis erat tenero damnata Quirino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 21.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40234" type="main" key="Qui^ri_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quĭrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. Quirinus, I.</etym>, <sense id="n40234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Quirinus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Romulus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Quirinal</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">spolia ex umeris Quirinis (al. Quirini),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 10, 11: <cit><quote lang="la">collis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Quirinal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:836" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 836</bibl></cit>.—Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Quĭrīna</orth>, q. v.—And hence, perh., <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, the <usg type="style">poet.</usg> appellation Quirinus, given to Augustus and Antony, cited under 1. Quirinus.</sense></entryFree>
quiris: <entryFree id="n40235" type="main" key="qui^ris1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭris</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭris</orth> <etym>Sabine</etym>, <sense id="n40235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive quod hasta curis (al. quiris) est dicta Sabinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:477" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 477</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40236" type="main" key="Qui^ri_s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quĭrīs</orth>, <itype>ītis</itype>, and mostly <number>plur.</number>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Quĭ-rītes</orth>, <itype>tĭum</itype> (or tum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 22, 9</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Cures</etym>. <sense id="n40236.0" n="I" level="1"> Originally, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the Sabine town</hi> Cures, <hi rend="ital">the Quirites</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">prisci Quirites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 710</bibl></cit> Serv.: veteres illi Sabini Quirites, Col. praef. § 19. —After the Sabines and the Romans had united in one community, under Romulus, the name of <hi rend="ital">Quirites</hi> was taken in addition to that of <hi rend="ital">Romani</hi>, the Romans calling themselves, in a civil capacity, <hi rend="ital">Quirites</hi>, while, in a political and military capacity, they retained the name of <hi rend="ital">Romani</hi>: post foedus Titi (Tatii) et Romuli placuit, ut quasi unus de duobus fieret populus. Unde et Romani Quirites dicti sunt, quod nomen Sabinorum fuerat a civitate Curibus; <cit><quote lang="la">et Sabini a Romulo Romani dicti sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 7, 710</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13</bibl>.— Joined with populus Romanus, the technical expression is usually POPVLVS ROMANVS QVIRITIVM, qs. <hi rend="ital">the Roman commonwealth of Quirite citizens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Roman nation of Quirites;</hi> but not unfreq. also in apposition: POPVLO ROMANO QVIRITIBVS (like homines prisci Latini, and populus priscorum Latinorum): QVOD BONVM FORTVNATVM FELIXQVE SALVTAREQVE SIET POPVLO ROMANO QVIRITIVM, REIQVE PVBLICAE POPVLI ROMANI QVIRITIVM ... OMNES QVIRITES, PEDITES ARMATOS PRIVATOSQVE VOCA INLICIVM HVC AD ME, Tab. Censor. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=86" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 86</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">populo Romano Quiritium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:16" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus Romanus Quiritium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi Romani Quiritium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32" default="NO" valid="yes">32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 28</bibl>; 22, 10 al.— In the other form: POPVLD ROMANO QVIRITIBVS, Inscr. Marin. Fratr. <pb n="1516" /> <cb n="QUIS" /> Arv. tab. 24, 1, 34; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib. 41:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 41, 2, 24</bibl>; so, an ancient formula ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 12, 14</bibl>, acc. to the MSS.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">too,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 24, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—We rarely meet with the form populo Romano Quiritibusque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6</bibl> (al. om. que); cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Paul. ex Fest. s. v. dici, p. 67 Müll.: devovisse eos se pro patriā Quiritibusque Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quiritium Romanorum exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum hoc populi Romain Quiritibus ostentum Cimbricis bellis,</quote> <trans><tr>to the citizens of the Roman nation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 32, 57, § 132</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">It was a reproach for soldiers to be addressed as Quirites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 52 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 358</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quiritium fossae dicuntur, quibus Ancus Marcius circumdedit urbem, quam secundum ostium Tiberis posuit, ex quo etiam Ostiam, et quia populi opera eas faceret, appellavit Quiritium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=254" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 254</bibl></cit> Müll.: jus Quiritium, <hi rend="ital">full Roman citizenship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ago gratias, domine, quod et jus Quiritium libertis necessariae mihi feminae, et civitatem Romanam Harpocrati iatraliptae meo indulsisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 6</bibl></cit> (22), 1: <cit><quote lang="la">Latinis jus Quiritium (constituit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 19</bibl></cit>: Latini jus Quiritium consequuntur his modis, beneficio principali, etc., Ulp. Reg. tit. 4, de Latinis.— <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: Quiris (also Quiritis, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 633</bibl> P.), <hi rend="ital">a Roman citizen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Quirite</hi>: ollus Quiris Leto datus, an ancient formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=254" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 254</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">dona Quiritis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddere jura Quiriti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:823" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 823</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minimum de plebe Quiritem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 7, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:47" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 47</bibl>: quibus una Quiritem Vertigo facit, <hi rend="ital">makes a Roman citizen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sets free</hi> (for in the ceremony of manumission the slave was turned around), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:75" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis te redonavit Quiritem Dis patriis?</quote> <trans><tr>an uninjured Roman citizen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulis repleto Quirite, i. e. populo Romano,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Carm. 12, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani more Quiritis, i. e. civis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 386</bibl></cit>: Quiris Eoüs, <hi rend="ital">an eastern Roman</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Constantinople</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 1, 31</bibl>.— In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. TVLLIVS Q. F. PONTIFEX SACR. IVNONIS QVIRITIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 308, 1</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40236.1" n="II" level="1"> (<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf.) Of bees, <hi rend="ital">citizens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commonalty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsae regem, parvosque Quirites Sufficiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 201</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quiritatio: <entryFree id="n40237" type="hapax" key="qui^ri_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭrītātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>quirito</etym>, <sense id="n40237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plaintive cry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a scream</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shriek</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiritatio facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quiritatus: <entryFree id="n40238" type="main" key="qui^ri_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭrītātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plaintive cry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scream</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shriek</hi> (post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ululatus feminarum, infantium quiritatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lamentabiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:2:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:2:8" default="NO">6, 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quirites: <entryFree id="n40239" type="main" key="Qui^ri_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quĭrītes</orth>, v. Quiris.</entryFree>
quirito: <entryFree id="n40240" type="main" key="qui^ri_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭrīto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> (in a <sense id="n40240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form: de Fenestellā quiritatur, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 377</bibl> P.), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [Quirites, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to cry</hi>: pro fidem, Quirites!], orig., to implore the aid of the Quirites or Roman citizens; hence, in gen. </sense><sense id="n40240.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to raise a plaintive cry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiritare dicitur is, qui Quiritum fidem clamans implorat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=68" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 68</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quiritare urbanorum, sic jubilare rusticorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl></cit>, § 68 ib.: clare quiritans, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 21, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox quiritantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 8</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40240.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of an orator, <hi rend="ital">to scream</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shriek</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 54</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40240.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40240.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To shriek out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cry aloud</hi> something: illi misero quiritanti, Civis Romanus natus sum, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 3</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40240.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bewail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lament</hi>, aliquid: <cit><quote lang="la">insanā voce casum mariti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 203, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8</bibl>, p. 209, 27.</sense></entryFree>
quirrito: <entryFree id="n40241" type="main" key="quirri_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quirrīto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, to utter the natural sound of the boar, <sense id="n40241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to grunt</hi>: quirritant verres, Auct Carm. Philom. 55.</sense></entryFree>
quis: <entryFree id="n40242" type="main" key="quis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quis</orth>, <itype>quid</itype> (old <sense id="n40242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. plur.</hi> QVES, S. C. Bacch.), <hi rend="ital">pron. interrog.</hi> [Sanscr. kis, in nakis = nemo; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ti/s</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">who? which? what? what man?</hi> (while qui, quae, quod, <hi rend="ital">interrog.</hi> is used adject.; for exceptions, v. qui and infra.—Quis is properly used only of more than two; uter, which of two? <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>). </sense><sense id="n40242.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> quis; lit., </sense><sense id="n40242.2" n="A" level="2"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, in a direct question. </sense><sense id="n40242.3" n="1" level="3"> Of males: <cit><quote lang="la">unde es? cujus es?</quote> <trans><tr>whose are you? to whom do you belong?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 44</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Da.</hi> Quis homo est? <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Ego sum Pamphilus, <hi rend="ital">who is there?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis clarior in Graeciā Themistocle? quis potentior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 12, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis Dionem doctrinis omnibus expolivit? non Plato?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 34, 139</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40242.4" n="2" level="3"> Quis, of females, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> and <pos>adj.</pos> (ante- and post-class.): et quis illaec<cb n="QUIS" />  est, quae? etc., Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 198, 3</bibl> (Trag. v. 133 Vahl.): quis tu es mulier, quae? etc., Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 197, 33</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=60" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 60</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">quis ea est, quam? etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>who is she?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis haec est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis illaec est mulier, quae? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec quis mulier est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 76</bibl></cit>: quis nostrarum fuit, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23</bibl>: quis haec est simia? Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 1, p. 84</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40242.5" n="B" level="2"> As <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n40242.6" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">what?</hi> i. e. <hi rend="ital">what sort of a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing?</hi> quis videor? <hi rend="ital">Cha.</hi> Miser aeque atque ego, <hi rend="ital">in what state</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition do I seem? what do you think of me now?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis ego sum? aut quae in me est facultas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 5, 17</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40242.7" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">nouns.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40242.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With words denoting a person (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quis eum senator appellavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis gracilis puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40242.9" n="(b)" level="5"> In gen. (in Cic. only before a vowel, for qui): <cit><quote lang="la">quis color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisve locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod caedis initium? quis finis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis esset tantus fructus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6, 22</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40242.10" n="II" level="1"> In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40242.11" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40242.12" n="1" level="3"> In simple constr.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid dicam de moribus facillimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est judicium corrumpere, si hoc non est?</quote> <trans><tr>what is bribing the court</tr>, <tr>if this be not?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ais? quid tibi nomen est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 208</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40242.13" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. partit.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">what?</hi> i. e. <hi rend="ital">what sort of? what kind of a?</hi> quid mulieris Uxorem habes? <hi rend="ital">what sort of a woman have you for a wife?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illuc est hominum secundum litus?</quote> <trans><tr>what is that knot of people?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid caelati argenti, quid stragulae vestis, quid pictarum tabularum ... apud illum putatis esse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 133</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">esp.: hoc enim, quis homo sit, ostendere est, non quid homo sit, dicere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to point out an individual</tr>, <tr>not to define a class</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40242.14" n="3" level="3"> Esp. in phrase quid dico? <hi rend="ital">what do I say?</hi> in correcting or strengthening the speaker's own expression: <cit><quote lang="la">Romae a. d. XIIII. Kal. volumus esse. Quid dico? Volumus? Immo vero cogimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:28:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 28, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:90:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 90, 365</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 9, 26</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40242.15" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40242.16" n="1" level="3"> Quid? <hi rend="ital">how? why? wherefore?</hi> quid? tu me hoc tibi mandasse existimas, ut? etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid hoc?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid? eundem nonne destituisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 38, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquere, quid venisti?</quote> <trans><tr>why? wherefore?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quid ego argumentor? quid plura disputo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:16:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 16, 44</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40242.17" n="2" level="3"> In quid? <hi rend="ital">wherefore? for what?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:13:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 13, 3</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40242.18" n="3" level="3"> Quid, with <hi rend="ital">particles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid, quod?</quote> <trans><tr>what shall be said to this</tr>, <tr>that? how is it that? and furthermore</tr>, <tr>moreover</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:25:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 25, 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 95</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ita?</quote> <trans><tr>why so?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:35:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 35, 99</bibl></cit>: quid ni, also in one word, quidni? <hi rend="ital">why not?</hi> (in rhet. questions, while cur non expects an answer); always with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 9:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 9, 3</bibl>; id. Ira, 1, 6, 1; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">separated: quid ego ni teneam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 28</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and pleonastically: quid ni non,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 52" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 52</bibl></cit>: quid si? <hi rend="ital">how if?</hi> Caecin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si illud addimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 14, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tum?</quote> <trans><tr>what then? how then?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:11:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 11, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 543</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 10, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 230</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ergo, ironically,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 20, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40242.19" n="III" level="1"> In indirect discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">quis sim, ex eo quem ad te misi, cognosces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 44, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogitat quis vir esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videbis, quid et quo modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: quis quem, <hi rend="ital">who ... whom? who ... the other?</hi> considera, quis quem fraudasse dicatur, <hi rend="ital">who is said to have defrauded whom?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos autem numeros cum quibus misceri oporteat, nunc dicendum est,</quote> <trans><tr>what ... with what?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:58:196" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 58, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notatum in sermone, quid quo modo caderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 16</bibl></cit>. — Quid with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exponam vobis breviter, quid hominis sit,</quote> <trans><tr>what sort of a man he is</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:54:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 54, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sciturum, quid ejus sit,</quote> <trans><tr>what there is in it</tr>, <tr>how much of it may be true</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.— Rarely for uter, <hi rend="ital">which of two</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whether</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerti quae pars sequenda esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 39, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia de occupando ponte crebra erant, nec qui potirentur, satis discerni poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut dii legerent, qui nomen novae urbi daret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 45, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 12, 5</bibl>; cf.: validior per Germaniam <cb n="QUIS" /> exercitus, propior aput Pannoniam; <cit><quote lang="la">quos igitur anteferret?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40243" type="main" key="quis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quis</orth>, <itype>quid</itype>, <sense id="n40243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron. indef.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40243.1" n="I" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40243.2" n="A" level="2"> Alone, <hi rend="ital">any one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any thing; some one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somebody</hi>, <hi rend="ital">something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperite, heus! Simoni me adesse, quis nunciate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simplicior quis, et est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum quis damni professus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto quis clarior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam cui facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:21:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 21, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40243.3" n="B" level="2"> In connection with <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nisi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te in judicium quis adducat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne cui falso assentiamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:21:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 21, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tecum agas quid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid in te peccavi ignosce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis quid de re publicā rumore acceperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quo usui esse posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 26, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid nimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi quid existimas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:73:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 73, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve quis invitam cogeret esse suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:30" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40243.4" n="II" level="1"> As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam quis forsitan hostis Haesura in nostro tela gerit latere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:13" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n40244" type="main" key="qui_s3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quīs</orth>, <itype>for quibus</itype>, v. quis and qui.</entryFree>
quisnam: <entryFree id="n40245" type="main" key="quisnam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quisnam</orth>, <itype>quaenam, quidnam</itype>, <sense id="n40245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron. interrog.</hi> [quis-nam], <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which</hi>, <hi rend="ital">what pray</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n40245.1" n="I" level="1"> In direct interrogation: <cit><quote lang="la">quisnam igitur tuebitur P. Scipionis memoriam mortui?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:36:section=80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 36, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed earum artificem quem? Quemnam?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>, § 5: cruciatur cor mihi et metuo. <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> Quidnam id est? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quidnam Pamphilum exanimatum video?</quote> <trans><tr>for what pray? why pray?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 6, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisnam igitur liber?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 83</bibl></cit>.— Sometimes joined, pleon., with <hi rend="ital">num</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">num quidnam amplius tibi cum illā fuit?</quote> <trans><tr>pray had you nothing further to do with her?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num quisnam praeterea? nemo est,</quote> <trans><tr>any body else?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:37:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 37, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num quidnam, Crassus inquit, novi?</quote> <trans><tr>is there any thing new?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Sometimes separated: in aedibus quid tibi meis nam erat negoti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu, malum, nam me retrahis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 26</bibl>.— Quisnam as <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis ea est nam optuma?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In the poets nam sometimes stands before quis: nam quae haec anus est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam quis te nostras Jussit adire domos?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 445</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40245.2" n="II" level="1"> In indirect discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">reviso, quidnam Chaerea hic rerum gerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sciam num quidnam afferat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserunt Delphos consultum, quidnam facerent de rebus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quispiam: <entryFree id="n40246" type="main" key="quispi^am"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quispĭam</orth>, <itype>quaepĭam, quodpĭam</itype>, and <sense id="n40246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> quidpiam or quippiam, <hi rend="ital">pron. indef.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any; some one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">some</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quispiam quin significet aliquis, et quaepiam aliquae, similiterque alia ejusdem generis, ut dubium non est, ita unde sequens pars ejus coeperit, inveniri non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=254" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 254</bibl></cit> Müll.: num non vis te moneam unum, si videtur quippiam? Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 129</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si hoc voluit quispiam deus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quaepiam cohors ex orbe excesserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de pecuniis repetundis nomen cuiuspiam deferatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cuipiam pecuniam fortuna ademit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ea vis ad aliam rem quampiam referatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne suspicari quidem possumus quemquam horum ab amico quippiam contendisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque Alexander, nec quispiam successorum, ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:7:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grammaticus quispiam de nobilioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quispiam ex his qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:21:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 21, 6</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliae quaepiam rationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum proferre ad quospiam coeperis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 361, 19</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">quidpĭam</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭppĭam</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in any respect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">num illi molestae quippiam sunt hae nuptiae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si grando quippiam nocuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:35:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 35, 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quisquam: <entryFree id="n40247" type="main" key="quisquam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quis-quam</orth> (old form QVIQVAM, S. C. Bacch.), quaequam, quicquam or quidquam (<sense id="n40247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. masc.</hi> quoquam, very rare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 57, 6</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc., and 34, 35, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 59</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">pron. indef.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">something</hi> (cf.: aliquis, ullus, quispiam). </sense><sense id="n40247.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n40247.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an invenire postulas quemquam cocum, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: nemo est indignior, quem quisquam homo aut amet <pb n="1517" /> <cb n="QUIS" /> aut adeat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cuiquam generi hominum, si cuiquam ordini aratorum probatus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:6:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi cuiquam legationi fui impedimento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 6</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40247.3" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">any man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any thing;</hi> also emphatic, <hi rend="ital">any person whoever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi> (even the least, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">sed mandare quemquam litteris cogitationes suas, qui eas nec disponere nec inlustrare possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quisquam est timidus, is ego sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quemquam interficiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 45, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut enim nemo, aut, si quisquam, ille sapiens fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quidquam humanorum certi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an quisquam usquam gentium est aeque miser?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">estne quisquam omnium mortalium, de quo melius existimes tu?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si animadversum esset, quemquam ad hostes transfugere conari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquam tu illa putas fuisse decreta?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percontans quisquamne in palatio esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 11" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Ep. 11</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40247.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40247.5" n="A" level="2"> Nec (neque) quisquam, <hi rend="ital">and no one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and none</hi>, = nemo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quisquam ex agmine tanto Audet adire virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 378</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrum quisquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ex castris Catilinae quisquam omnium discesserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 36, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque cuiquam nostrum licuit lege uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 33, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40247.6" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">unus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a single one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia nondum in quemquam unum saeviebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55, 15</bibl></cit>. — Hence also, nec quisquam unus, <hi rend="ital">and not a single one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quisquam alterius gentis unus tantum eā arte excellit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 9, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40247.7" n="C" level="2"> Quicquam with <hi rend="ital">nihil</hi>, pleonastically, <hi rend="ital">nothing whatever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nothing at all</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comperiebam, nihil ad Pamphilum Quicquam attinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40247.8" n="D" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">numquam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nocet numquam cuiquam,</quote> <trans><tr>no man at any time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam quidquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:12:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 12, 29</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40247.9" n="E" level="2"> Quisquam as a <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, like quis (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec quisquam alia mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anum quemquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illarum neque te quisquam novit, neque, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quisque: <entryFree id="n40248" type="main" key="quisque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quis-que</orth>, <itype>quaeque, quodque</itype>, and <sense id="n40248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> quicque (quidque), <hi rend="ital">pron. indef.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whoever</hi> or <hi rend="ital">whatever it be</hi>, <hi rend="ital">each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every thing</hi> (prop. of more than two persons or things; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">uterque): non tute incommodam rem, ut quaeque est, in animum induces pati?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ut in quo quisque artificio excelleret, is in suo genere Roscius diceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 130</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:24:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 24, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum quisque laudat, quantum se posse sperat imitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cuique obtigit, id quisque teneat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni est judicis statuere, quid quemque cuique praestare oporteat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi quoque tendente, ut periculo prius evaderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quaeque stellae in iis, finitimisque partibus sint quoque tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 42, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamcumque rem a quoque cognorit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:15:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 15, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrobes ternorum pedum in quamque partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximis quibusque correptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prout quique monitione indigerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:89" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 89</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuorum quisque necessariorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantulum enim summae curtabit quisque dierum, Si,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 124</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo quisque est sollertior, hoc docet laboriosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo majus quodque animal, eo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quique (pedes) sunt temporibus pleniores, hoc, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus liber melior est quisque, quo major,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, to express universality (quisque is then placed after the <hi rend="ital">sup.;</hi> class. with <number>sing.</number> and <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.;</hi> rare with <hi rend="ital">plur. masc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>): doctissimus quisque, <hi rend="ital">every learned man</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">all the learned</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recentissima quaeque sunt correcta et emendata maxime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni arte optimum quidque rarissimum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:25:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 25, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperrima quaeque ad laborem deposcimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 6, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 31:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 31, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum quodque spectate, milites, decus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 32, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquissimum quodque tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravissima quaeque grana serere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 8, 20, § 85</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">plur. masc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: optumi <cb n="QUIS" /> quique expetebant a me doctrinam sibi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortissimis quibusque amissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:6:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 51, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi mortales convenere ... maxime proximi quique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tot leges et proximae quaeque duriores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 21, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:10:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 10, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae longissimae quaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 33, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 11, 2</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">With ordinal numerals, to denote generality, universality (placed after the ordinal): vix decimus quisque est, qui ipsus se noverit,</quote> <trans><tr>scarcely one in ten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertio quoque verbo excitabatur,</quote> <trans><tr>at every other word</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: quinto quoque anno, <hi rend="ital">every fifth year</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">every four years</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:56:section=139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 56, § 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinto quoque palo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 169</bibl></cit>.—Rarely of time (days, years, etc.), without an ordinal numeral: <cit><quote lang="la">notentur, quae (ova) quoque die sint edita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annis quibusque,</quote> <trans><tr>every year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 15, § 52</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">primus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the very first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the first possible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo quoque tempore,</quote> <trans><tr>as soon as possible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo quoque die,</quote> <trans><tr>at the earliest day</tr>, <tr>as soon as possible</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitui diem primam quamque dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>the earliest day possible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum quicque videamus,</quote> <trans><tr>the very first</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.— Quisque stands freq. in app. with <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi quisque vident, eunt obviam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi quisque habeant, quod suom est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decimus quisque ad supplicium lecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">octo delecti notissimus quisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(consules) in suas quisque provincias proficiscerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 44, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">viri in vestibulo suarum quisque aedium stabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultimi cum suis quisque ducibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:2:6" default="NO">5, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:20" default="NO">6, 11, 20</bibl>.— Often in connection with <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suus</hi> (in good prose almost always placed after the <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi>, Zumpt, Gram. § 701; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Krebs, Antibarb. p. 983): pro se quisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro se quisque ad populum loquebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:27:section=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 27, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quanti quisque se ipse faciat, tanti fiat ab amicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam quisque homo rem meminit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 5, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum suo cuique judicio sit utendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edixit, ut quod quisque a sacris haberet, id in suum quidque fanum referret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 34, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo feret natura sua quemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:56:204" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 56, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere quos cupio nomine quemque suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:64" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisque suos patimur Manes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 743</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum quisque flagitium aliis objectantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos Poenus in civitates quemque suas dimisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 48, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:2:8" default="NO">33, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 37</bibl>.—Quisque, of two, for uterque, <hi rend="ital">each</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula quisque suae matri properata tulerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F 2, 715</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duas civitates ex unā factas: suos cuique parti magistratus, suas leges esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:44:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 44, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 12, 3</bibl>; 27, 35, 3; <cit><quote lang="la">for utercumque: ut cujusque populi cives vicissent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 24, 3</bibl></cit> (dub. al. cujus) — Quisque as <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> for quaeque, like quis (ante - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes meretrices, ubi quisque habitant, invenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo quisque pacto hic vitam vostrarum exigat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40248.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for quicunque, <hi rend="ital">whosoever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every one who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all that</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">quemque videritis hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">at tu, quisque doles, amice lector,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 11</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in carm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quisquiliae: <entryFree id="n40249" type="main" key="quisqui^li^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quisquĭlĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n40249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">quisquĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 75</bibl>; cf.: quisquilia, <foreign lang="greek">sku/bala,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.) [prob. from quisque, all sorts of things, odds and ends]. </sense><sense id="n40249.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the waste</hi> or <hi rend="ital">refuse</hi> of any thing, <hi rend="ital">the droppings of trees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sweepings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offscourings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rubbish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisquiliae dici putantur quicquid ex arboribus minutis surculorum foliorumve cadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=257" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 257</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quisquiliae, stipulae immixta esurculis et foliis aridis: sunt autem purgamenta terrarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 6</bibl></cit>; and: quisquiliae, <foreign lang="greek">sku/bala, fruga/nwn xai=tai, periyh/mata,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">quisquilias, volantes, venti spolia, memoras, Caecil. ap. Fest. l. l.: quisquiliae frumenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Amos, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nugas marinas et quisquilias litorales quaerere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 296, 36</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40249.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of vile or worthless persons, beasts, or things, <hi rend="ital">refuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outcast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">riffraff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dregs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rubbish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trash</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omitto Numerium, Serranum, Aelium, quisquilias seditionis Clodianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:43:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 43, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 6</bibl>: <cb n="QUIV" /> homo non, quisquiliae, Nov. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=257" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 257</bibl> Müll.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of worthless fish,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corcillum est, quod homines facit: cetera quisquilia omnia,</quote> <trans><tr>are trifles</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quisquilium: <entryFree id="n40250" type="main" key="quisqui^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quisquĭlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. in quisquiliae <sense id="n40250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quisquis: <entryFree id="n40251" type="main" key="quisquis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quis-quis</orth>, <itype>quaeque, quodquod</itype>, and <sense id="n40251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> quicquid, quidquid, <hi rend="ital">pron. rel.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whoever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whosoever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whatever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whatsoever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every one who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all</hi>: hostem qui feriet, mihi erit Carthaginiensis, Quisquis erit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 22, 51</bibl> (Ann. v. 285 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">quisquis homo huc venerit, vapulabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisquis es, quicquid tibi nomen est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisquis ille est, qui adest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia mala ingerebat, quemquem aspexerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemquem hominem attigerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ego in mari, quicquid inest, reperi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quicquid id est, jam sciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid animo cernimus, id omne oritur a sensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:19:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 19, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quinam est iste epilogus? aveo enim audire, quicquid est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:47:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 47, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esto ut hi sint, quiqui integri sunt, et sani,</quote> <bibl
