n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 45, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberos suos quibusquibus Romanis mancipio dabant,</quote> <trans><tr>to every Roman</tr>, <tr>without exception</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoquo consilio fecit,</quote> <trans><tr>with whatever design</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoquo tempore fuerit,</quote> <trans><tr>at what time soever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 2</bibl></cit>, a, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">quoquo modo se res habet,</quote> <trans><tr>however it may be</tr>, <tr>be it as it may</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoquo modo accipitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid a quoquo eorum, quos, quasve ibi habebunt, furtum factum esse dicetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:5:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">plur. verb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisquis ubique, viri, dociles advertite mentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisquis amas, scabris hoc bustum caedito saxis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 77: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc procul absitis, quisquis colis arte capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:45" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 45</bibl></cit> (1, 6, 39). — Quisquis, and esp. freq., quicquid, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum quisquis amicior Afris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at o deorum quicquid in caelo regit,</quote> <trans><tr>all ye gods who</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quidquid deorum est,</quote> <trans><tr>by all the gods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid maleficii, sceleris, caedis erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:42:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 42, 122</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but also adject. (rare): quisquis honos tumuli, quidquid solamen humandi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille quicquid usquam concipitur nefas Tractavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 48</bibl></cit>. — <itype>Quidquid</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">how much soever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid progredior,</quote> <trans><tr>whithersoever</tr>, <tr>the farther</tr>, <tr>the more</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid ab urbe longius proferrent arma, magis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ride, quicquid amas, Cato, Catullum, i. e. quantum,</quote> <trans><tr>as much as</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 56, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid ita educati liberi patrem amare videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:23" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 23</bibl></cit>.— Quisquis as <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, like quis (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mulier, quisquis es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisquis es, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 102</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quisquislibet: <entryFree id="n40252" type="main" key="quisquisli^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quisquis-lĭbet</orth>, quidquid-libet, <sense id="n40252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron. indef.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whoever it may be</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whatever it may be</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quidquidlibet dederis pro te, vile est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Avar. 3, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quitus: <entryFree id="n40253" type="main" key="qui^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭtus</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. queo.</entryFree>
quivis: <entryFree id="n40254" type="main" key="qui_vi_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quī-vīs</orth>, <itype>quaevis, quodvis</itype> (<case>abl.</case> quīvis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 3, 1</bibl>), and <sense id="n40254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> quidvis, <hi rend="ital">pron. indef.</hi> (separated: <cit><quote lang="la">quod genus vis propagabis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 52</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">who</hi> or <hi rend="ital">what you please</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any whatever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter non minus, quam vostrum quivis, formidat malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaevis alia mora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia sunt ejusmodi, quivis ut perspicere possit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 27, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quemvis numerum ephippiatorum equitum quamvis pauci adire audent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaevis amplificationes,</quote> <trans><tr>all sorts of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:53:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 53, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus amet quāvis aspergere cunctos, i. e. quāvis ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 87</bibl></cit>: ab quīvis (<case>abl.</case>) homine beneficium accipere gaudeas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujusvis opes voluisse contra illius potentiam crescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quovis modo inceptum perficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 11, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quovis sermone molestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eripiet quivis oculos citius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 35</bibl></cit>.—Joined with <hi rend="ital">unus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any one you please</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any one whatever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">una harum quaevis causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tu solus, aut quivis unus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:22:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 22, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quivis unus ex populo, sed existimator doctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:93:320" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 93, 320</bibl></cit>. — <orth extent="full" lang="la">quidvīs</orth>, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any thing whatever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">no matter what</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere hic quidvis licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidvis satis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quidvis satis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 127</bibl></cit>.— <pb n="1518" /> <cb n="QUOA" /> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidvis anni,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>at any season of the year</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quiviscumque: <entryFree id="n40255" type="main" key="qui_viscumque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quīvis-cumque</orth>, <itype>quaeviscumque, quodviscumque</itype>, <sense id="n40255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron. indef.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi> or <hi rend="ital">what you please</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any whatsoever you will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nec repentis itum cujusviscumque animantis Sentimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 388</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoviscumque loco potes,</quote> <trans><tr>at whatever place you please</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:1:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quiza: <entryFree id="n40256" type="main" key="Quiza"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quiza</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n40256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fortress of Mauritania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the present Giza</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Oran</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 2, 1, § 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quo: <entryFree id="n40257" type="main" key="quo_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>prop. <case>dat.</case> or <case>abl.</case> of qui</etym>. <sense id="n40257.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Where</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">respondit, se nescire, quo loci esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo loci illa nasceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:66:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 66, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitte sectari rosa quo locorum Sera moretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 38, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40257.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40257.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">For which reason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wherefore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miscella (uva) multo ante coquitur: quo prior legenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:54" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anseres voraces sunt naturā: quo temperandum iis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:10:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo aequior sum Pamphilo, Si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 6, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo magis hoc philosopho faciendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo factum est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Them. 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40257.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">For the reason that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non edepol quo te impudicam crederem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod scribis, non quo ipse audieris, sed te ipsum putare, me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quo libenter male audiam, sed quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:75:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 75, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non eo dico, quo mihi veniat in dubium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque eo nunc dico, quo quidquam illum senserim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non pol, quo quemquam plus amem, Eo feci, sed,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40257.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in which place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whither</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where</hi> (<hi rend="ital">rel.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">interrog</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">dolia, quo vinaceos condat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo, quo, scelesti, ruitis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus, quo exercitui aditus non erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non longius hostes aberant, quam quo telum adici potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 5, 3</bibl>.— Of persons, <hi rend="ital">to whom</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dabo parasitum inanem, quo recondas reliquias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo illae nubent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo lubeat, nubant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: hominem beatum, quo illae pervenibunt divitiae! Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 508, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo apud eos, quo se contulit, gratiosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:18:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 18, § 38</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo gentium,</quote> <trans><tr>where in the world</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:54:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 54, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne hodie quidem scire videmini, quo amentiae progressi sitis,</quote> <trans><tr>how far</tr>, <tr>to what pitch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40257.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to what end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for what purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wherefore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">why</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid hoc homine facias? aut quo civem importunum, aut quo potius hostem tam sceleratum reserves?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo tantam pecuniam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:55:section=137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 55, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixit profecto, quo vellet aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:21:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 21, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescis, quo valeat nummus? quem praebeat usum?</quote> <trans><tr>what money is good for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo mihi fortunam, si non conceditur uti?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fam 7, 23, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 4, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40257.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to the end that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in order that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo deteriores anteponantur bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id adjuta me, quo id flat facilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo mare finiat iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraus mea quid petiit, nisi quo tibi jungerer uni?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:20:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi omnes Athenas se contulerunt, non quo sequerentur otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo ne, = ut ne: sed eo vidisti multum, quod praefinisti, quo ne pluris emerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautum erat, quo ne plus auri et argenti facti, quo ne plus signati argenti et aeris domi haberemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40257.7" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Indef.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to any place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anywhither</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quo tu me ire vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando Romam aliove quo mitterent legatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quo erat longius prodeundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quoad: <entryFree id="n40258" type="main" key="quo^ad"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏ-ad</orth> (monosyl., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:849" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 849</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 91</bibl>; collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">quaad</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 641, 357</bibl>; cf. Cardin. Dipl. p. 22, 30, and n. 337, and Cavedon. Marm. Moden. p. 243), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>orig. quod-ad = ad quod</etym>, <sense id="n40258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">how long?</hi> </sense><sense id="n40258.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in direct questions (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">senem Quoad exspectatis vestrum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40258.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40258.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">As long as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quousque, inquies? quoad erit integrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamdiu velle debebis, quoad te, quantum proficias, non poenitebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: quoad vixit, <cb n="QUOD" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:23:section=60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 23, § 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40258.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Till</hi>, <hi rend="ital">until</hi>, <hi rend="ital">until that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum usque eo retinuit, quoad renuntiatum est vicisse Boeotios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus existimo, consolationem recte adhibitam esse, quoad certior fieres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoad ipse cum exercitu propius accessisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:9:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 9, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40258.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">How far</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as far as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videte nunc, quoad fecerit iter apertius, quam antea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jus civile eatenus exercuerunt, quoad populum praestare voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoad insequi poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40258.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">So far as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as much as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubeo te salvere voce summā, quoad vires valent,</quote> <trans><tr>as far as my strength reaches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est modus tamen, quoad pati uxorem oportet,</quote> <trans><tr>to what extent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoad patiatur consuetudo,</quote> <trans><tr>as far as custom permits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognitis, quoad possunt ab homine cognosci, bonorum et malorum finibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:38:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 38, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quoad possem et liceret, nunquam discederem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 3</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. ejus</hi> in the phrase, quoad ejus facere possum, <hi rend="ital">as far</hi> or <hi rend="ital">as well as I can</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu tamen velim ne intermittas, quoad ejus (facere) poteris, scribere ad me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 12, 4</bibl></cit> (B. and K. quod); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 2, 2</bibl> Orell.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quoad ejus fieri possit,</quote> <trans><tr>as much as possible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id eos ut prohiberet, quoad ejus sine bello posset. praetori mandatum est,</quote> <trans><tr>as far as possible without having recourse to arms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 45</bibl></cit>.—Without <hi rend="ital">ejus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoad facere potui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:72:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 72, 291</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40258.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">With respect to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as to</hi>, = quod attinet ad (with the <case>acc.</case> only in the foll. examples where the text is doubtful): <cit><quote lang="la">quoad diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 6, 6</bibl></cit> MSS. (Weissenb. quam ad diem): <cit><quote lang="la">quoad sexum, multitudinem, casum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:23:section=46" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, 23, § 46</bibl></cit> Müll. (MSS. quod sexum; perh. ad is omitted; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Müll. ad loc.): nec interest, quoad feras bestias et volucres, utrum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 3</bibl></cit> (Momms. quod ad feras).</sense></entryFree>
quoadusque: <entryFree id="n40259" type="main" key="quo^a^dusque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏăd-usque</orth>, <itype>or, separated</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏăd usque</orth>, <sense id="n40259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">until that</hi> (post-class.), Aug. Civ. Dei, 1, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 12, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Cant. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 7, 18</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 58</bibl>, a false read.).</sense></entryFree>
quocirca: <entryFree id="n40260" type="main" key="quo_circa_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quō-circā</orth> (separated: <sense id="n40260.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">quo, bone, circa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 95</bibl></cit>; old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">quōqirca</orth>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">Q</ref></xr>), <hi rend="ital">conj.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for which reason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wherefore</hi> (rare but class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:59" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quocirca bene apud majores nostros senatus decrevit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 41, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quocirca nihil esse tam detestabile, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 12, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 673</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quocirca mecum loquor haec,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 145</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 135</bibl>.—Relat.: QVOCIRCA EVM IN ITALIA ESSE NON LICEAT, Inscr. Mazocchi, p. 423, 43.</sense></entryFree>
quocumque: <entryFree id="n40261" type="main" key="quo_cumque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quō-cumque</orth> (in tmesi: <sense id="n40261.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">quo nos cumque feret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo res cumque cadent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 709</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo ea me cumque ducet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:5:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>), <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to whatever place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whithersoever</hi> (class): <cit><quote lang="la">quocumque venerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:65:section=167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 65, § 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi, quocumque inciderunt, veterem consuetudinem fori requirunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire, pedes quocumque ferent, quocumque per undas Notus vocabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:21" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 682</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio ita flexibilis, ut sequatur quocumque torqueas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 16, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequar te, quocumque ieris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quocumque me verto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quod: <entryFree id="n40262" type="main" key="quod1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quod</orth>, <sense id="n40262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> [<hi rend="ital">acc. resp.</hi>, from qui]. </sense><sense id="n40262.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quia, quoniam): cum tibi agam gratias quod me vivere coëgisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirari, Cato se aiebat, quod non rideret haruspex, haruspicem cum vidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:24:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 24, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecisti mihi pergratum, quod Serapionis librum ad me misisti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter hanc causam, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr 2, 3, 46, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod victoribus ultro inferrent arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam quod urbes urerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp.: propterea quod,</quote> <trans><tr>because</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; v. propterea. —Esp. after <hi rend="ital">eo</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">eo deceptum, quod neque, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo conspectius (supplicium), quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 34, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:25:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 25, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma navium eo differt, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 59, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 7:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40262.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Wherefore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">why</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in viam quod te des hoc tempore, nihil est,</quote> <trans><tr>it is not necessary that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 12</bibl></cit>: magis est quod gratuler <cb n="QUOM" /> tibi quam, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne causae quid sit, quod te quisquam quaeritet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc est quod ad vos venio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est quod multa loquamur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 30</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40262.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">If so be that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as respects that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in case that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod quispiam ignem quaerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 3, 13</bibl></cit> Ussing ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 7</bibl> Brix ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:68:section=175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 68, § 175</bibl>; cf. qui, E. 1. — </sense><sense id="n40262.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Though</hi>, <hi rend="ital">although</hi>, <hi rend="ital">albeit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">even if</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te in plateā offendero hāc post umquam, quod dicas mihi, Alium quaerebam, iter hac habui, periisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 1, 49; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 261</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 705</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sim ligneus, ut vides, Prendam te tamen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40262.5" n="V" level="1"> In respect to time, <hi rend="ital">since that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">since</hi> (only post-Aug.; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 146</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">recent edd. read quom): tertius dies est, quod audivi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 27, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40262.6" n="VI" level="1"> After <hi rend="ital">facere</hi> and <hi rend="ital">facile est</hi>, = ut, <hi rend="ital">that</hi>: facile est, quod habeant conservam in villā, Varr, R. R. 2, 10, 6: utinam dii immortales fecissent, quod ea lex etiam populo Romano esset constituta, Vitr. praef. 10.—</sense><sense id="n40262.7" n="VII" level="1"> With other <hi rend="ital">particles</hi>, as <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nisi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utinam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ubi</hi>, etc., always with reference to something which precedes (very freq.), <hi rend="ital">but</hi>, <hi rend="ital">though</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si quis illorum legat facta, paria horum cognoscat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si te fors Afris praefecisset, tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:9:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 9, § 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 14, § 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nisi domi civium suorum invidiā debilitatus esset, Romanos videtur superare potuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod utinam minus vitae cupidi fuissemus!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ne longiore exordio legentem fatigemus, unum quasi exemplum subiciemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ubi ille intellexit, id agi, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cum esset animadversum, conjunctam esse flumini, protinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ut hanc quoque curam determinemus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 23, 53, § 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccasse se non anguntur, objurgari moleste ferunt: quod contra oportebat delicto dolere, correctione gaudere,</quote> <trans><tr>instead of which</tr>, <tr>whereas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 24, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nunc,</quote> <trans><tr>whereas now</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 221</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40262.8" n="VIII" level="1"> With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi> of perceiving and declaring, instead of an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio jam, filius quod amet meus istanc meretricem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 7, § 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recordatus quondam super cenam, quod nihil cuiquam toto die praestitisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec credit, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliqui semen ejus non obruunt, opinantes, quod a nullā ave tangatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem miram de ocimo Martialis affirmat, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notum facere, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 25, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novi quod pulchra sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidit lucem quod esset bona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—Esp. after <hi rend="ital">illud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videndum illud, quod, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 20, 70</bibl></cit>: illud mihi occurrit, quod, etc., Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>?*! Quod, in restrictive sense, v. qui, E. 1.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n40263" type="gloss" key="quod2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quod</orth>, another orthogr. for quot, v. h. v.</entryFree>
quodammodo: <entryFree id="n40264" type="main" key="quo_dammo^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quōdam-mŏdo</orth>, <itype>or, separated</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">quō-dam mŏdo</orth> (in tmesi: <sense id="n40264.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">quodam tamen modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 5</bibl></cit>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quidam-modus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">in a certain manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a measure</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quodammodo latebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voce, motu, formā etiam magnifica et generosa quodammodo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:261" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 75, 261</bibl></cit>. diligamus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 8, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or 1, 59, 251</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quodsemelarripides: <entryFree id="n40265" type="main" key="Quodse^me^larri^pi^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Quod-sĕmĕl-arrĭpĭdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>quod-semel-arripio</etym>, <sense id="n40265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">That-snatches-onceides</hi>, a comically formed proper name, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 6, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quoi: <entryFree id="n40266" type="main" key="quoi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quoi</orth>, i. q. cui, v. 1. qui <sense id="n40266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quojas: <entryFree id="n40267" type="main" key="quo_jas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quōjas</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">quōjātis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, i. q. cujas or cujatis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 33</bibl> et saep.</entryFree>
quojus: <entryFree id="n40268" type="main" key="quo_jus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quōjus</orth>, <itype>for cujus</itype>, v. 1. qui.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40269" type="main" key="quo_jus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quōjus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = <orth extent="full" lang="la">cujus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 14</bibl>.</entryFree>
quolibet: <entryFree id="n40270" type="main" key="quo_li^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quō-lĭbet</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quilibet</etym>, <sense id="n40270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">whither it pleases</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to any place whatever</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">gubernaculum contorquet quolibet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:902" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 902</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quolibet ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:8:22" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 8, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quom: <entryFree id="n40271" type="main" key="quom"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quom</orth>, v 2. cum <sense id="n40271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quominus: <entryFree id="n40272" type="main" key="quo_mi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quō-mĭnus</orth>, <sense id="n40272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that not</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from</hi>, after verbs of hindering, preventing, etc.; v. minus under parvus.</sense></entryFree>
quomodo: <entryFree id="n40273" type="main" key="quo_mo^do^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quō-mŏdŏ</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">quō mŏdŏ</orth> (in tmesi: <sense id="n40273.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">quo tu me modo voles esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:4:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 4, 14</bibl>), <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">in what manner</hi>, <pb n="1519" /> <cb n="QUON" /> <hi rend="ital">in what way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40273.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Interrog.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quomodo? Quantum poposcerit Apronius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:10:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 10, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maecenas quomodo tecum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo palam factum est verbum istud?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at scin, quo modo tibi res se habet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fratre, an sine eo cum filio, an quomodo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40273.2" n="B" level="2"> In exclamations: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo se venditant Caesari!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo mortem filii tulit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40273.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rel.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non meminisse nos ratus, quomodo trecentos Philippos vilico dederis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec negotia quomodo se habeant, ne epistula quidem narrare audeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo homines non inepti loquuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo modo nunc se istorum artes habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:32:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 32, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se aliquam rationem inituros, quomodo ab Hispanis sumant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 48</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40273.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp. corresp. to <hi rend="ital">sic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in what manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the same manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">even as</hi>: et quo modo hoc est consequens illi, sic illud huic. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:7:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 7, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo modo in omni vită praecipitur, sic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:38:136" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 38, 136</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40273.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Indef.</hi> for quocumque modo, <hi rend="ital">in whatever way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo modo potuissem, te convenissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 1</bibl></cit> (B. and K. ex conj. quoquo modo).</sense></entryFree>
quomodocumque: <entryFree id="n40274" type="main" key="quo_mo^do^cumque^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quōmŏdŏ-cumquĕ</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-cunquĕ</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <sense id="n40274.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">in what manner soever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">howsoever</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quomodocumque dicitur, intellegi tamen potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 30</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40274.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">be it as it may</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in any way whatever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tamen quomodocumque, quamquam sumus pauperculi, est domi quod edimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:23:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 23, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quomodolibet: <entryFree id="n40275" type="main" key="quo_mo^do^li^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quōmŏdŏ-lĭbet</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n40275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">howsoever</hi> (eccl. Lat.): qui quomodolibet vixerint, Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 19.</sense></entryFree>
quomodonam: <entryFree id="n40276" type="main" key="quo_mo^do^nam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quōmŏdŏ-nam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n40276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in what manner pray? how?</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quomodonam, mi frater, de nostris versibus Caesar?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 16, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quonam: <entryFree id="n40277" type="main" key="quo_nam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quō-nam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <sense id="n40277.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Whither pray?</hi> (class.): quo tu te agis? <hi rend="ital">Char.</hi> Quonam, nisi domum? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam si nunc sequor, quonam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quonam haec omnia, nisi ad suam perniciem pertinere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40277.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">How far pray?</hi> quonam usque? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:215" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 215</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 511</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Achill. 1, 624</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quondam: <entryFree id="n40278" type="main" key="quondam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quondam</orth> (CONDAM, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Rein.</author> p. 543</bibl>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quom = cum, with the demonstr. part. dam</etym>. <sense id="n40278.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">At a certain time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at one time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">once</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heretofore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formerly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum tempestas, memini, quondam fuit, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olim, olim isti fuit generi quondam quaestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus illa quondam socrus, paulo ante uxor fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:66:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 66, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quae sunt conclusa nunc artibus, dissipata quondam fuerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or 1, 42, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus Romanus, qui quondam in hostes lenissimus existimabatur, hoc tempore, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:53:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 53, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quondam Marsaeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 21</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:3" default="NO">3, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:547" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 547</bibl>.— Of those deceased, <hi rend="ital">the late</hi>, <hi rend="ital">former</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceased</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">OPTIMAE MEMORIAE VIRO QVOND. FILIO AELII, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 389, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Valeriani quondam centurionis testamentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matris tuae quondam mancipia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 33, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 57, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyro quondam rege,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 1, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40278.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40278.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">At certain times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sometimes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid, cum saepe lapidum, sanguinis nonnumquam, terrae interdum, quondam etiam lactis imber effluxit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 43, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachum, cujus tu similem quondam habebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quondam cithara tacentem Suscitat Musam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quondam etiam victis redit in praecordia virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 367</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 170</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus quondam legatos decreverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40278.3" n="B" level="2"> Of the future, <hi rend="ital">one day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">some day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ever</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Romula quondam Ullo se tantum tellus jactabit alumno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:877" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 877</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tibi vir quondam, nunc frater, mittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:1:23" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 1, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quoniam: <entryFree id="n40279" type="main" key="quo^ni^am"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏn-ĭam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quom = cum, and jam</etym>, <sense id="n40279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">since now</hi>, <hi rend="ital">since then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">since</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seeing that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whereas</hi> (quoniam gives a ground or reason, quod and quia give the determining cause or reason). </sense><sense id="n40279.1" n="I" level="1"> With <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>, stating a fact: quoniam significat non solum id quod quia, sed etiam id quod <cb n="QUOR" /> postquam, hac scilicet de causā, quod Graeci <foreign lang="greek">e)pei/,</foreign> utriusque significationem obtinet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=261" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 261</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam ambo nos delusistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. prol. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam quidem circumventus inimicis praeceps agor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C 31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C 31, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 85, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:31:21" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam ad hunc locum perventum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam me stultitiam (quoniam non est genus unum) Insanire putas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam ita tu vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:33:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 33, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quapropter, quoniam res in id discrimen adducta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 11, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 55</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40279.2" n="II" level="1"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> (introducing a reason conceived by the mind, or given by another person): <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam civitati consulere non possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam magna sequatur ubertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 14, 14, § 34</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eum. 9, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam tam propinqua sint castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 40</bibl></cit>; 7, 72; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 72</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40279.3" n="III" level="1"> Introducing an <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi> (post-class.), <hi rend="ital">that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videtis quoniam et vos hoc facere videtis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non advertit, quoniam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:100" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:8:53" default="NO">2, 8, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">negat quoniam Jesus non est Christus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,023:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Joan. 2, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. v. 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Cor. 6, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quopiam: <entryFree id="n40280" type="main" key="quo_pi^am"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quō-pĭam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quo</etym>, <sense id="n40280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to any place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whithersoever</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quopiam devorti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iturane, Thais, quopiam es?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quoquam: <entryFree id="n40281" type="main" key="quo_quam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quō-quam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <sense id="n40281.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To any place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whithersoever</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut hanc ne quoquam mitteret, nisi ad se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">meare diversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 428</bibl></cit> Lachm.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque se quoquam movit ex Urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:21:section=52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 21, § 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ivit servus tuus quoquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 5, 25</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n40281.1" n="II" level="1"> = in aliquam rem, <hi rend="ital">in any thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in aught</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque quoquam posse resolvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1053" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1053</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quoque: <entryFree id="n40282" type="main" key="quo^que1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏque</orth>, <sense id="n40282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also</hi>, <hi rend="ital">too</hi> (subjoined to the emphatic word in a clause) [etym. dub.; perh. for quomque; v. R<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:Lat. Part. p. 23 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Lat. Part. p. 23 sq.</bibl>]: <cit><quote lang="la">quă de causa Helvetii quoque reliquos Gallos virtute praecedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me scilicet maxime, sed proxime illum quoque fefellissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae quis exsul Se quoque fugit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me quoque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te quoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sophistae solum, sed philosophi quoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:12:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoque enim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 18, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:7" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 50, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 12, 15</bibl>; 27, 22, 9; 30, 1, 3 al.; cf. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:33:108, p. 328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 33, 108, p. 328</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoque igitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 10, 32</bibl></cit>.—Pleon. with <hi rend="ital">etiam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">et</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin mihi quoque etiam est ad portum negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est etiam quoque, uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 517</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt vero et fortunae eorum (leonum) quoque clementiae exempla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 21, § 56</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40282.1" n="II" level="1"> = quidem: sese ne id quoque facturum esse, <hi rend="ital">not even</hi>, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n40283" type="main" key="quo_que2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quōque</orth> = et quo.</entryFree>
quoqueversus: <entryFree id="n40284" type="gloss" key="quo_que^versus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quōquĕversus</orth>, v. quoquoversus.</entryFree>
quoquo: <entryFree id="n40285" type="main" key="quo_quo_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quō-quō</orth>, <itype>or, separated</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">quō quō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quisquis</etym>, <sense id="n40285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to whatever place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whithersoever</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quoquo ibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoquo venias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoquo hic spectabit, eo tu spectato simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoquo sese verterint Stoici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:9:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 9, 24</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gentium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoquo hinc abducta est gentium,</quote> <trans><tr>to whatever place in the world she has been carried off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quoquo terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quoquomodo: <entryFree id="n40286" type="main" key="quo_quo_mo^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quōquō-mŏdo</orth>, <itype>or, separated</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">quō-quō mŏdo</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quisquis-modus</etym>, <sense id="n40286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in what way soever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">howsoever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoquomodo se res habeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu quoquomodo hominem investiges velim,</quote> <trans><tr>in every possible way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu cum esses praetor renuntiatus quoquo modo,</quote> <trans><tr>I will not say how</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:15:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 15, § 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quoquoversus: <entryFree id="n40287" type="main" key="quo_quo_versus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quōquō-versus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-um</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">quōquō-vorsum</orth> (QVOQVEVERSVS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 207</bibl>, lin. 19; 21; 26; 801, 12) [quoquo-versus], <sense id="n40287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in every direction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every way</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">legatos quoquoversus dimittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 7, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes decem quoquovorsum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 15, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:2" default="NO">8, 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quorsum: <entryFree id="n40288" type="main" key="quorsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quorsum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">quorsus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quovorsus or -um</etym>, <sense id="n40288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to what place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whitherward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whither</hi>, </sense><sense id="n40288.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: nescio hercle, neque <cb n="QUOT" /> unde eam, neque quorsum eam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerit quorsus potissimum in praedam superne sese ruat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 1, p. 341, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40288.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">whither</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenes, quorsum haec tendant, quae loquor?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sane curae est, quorsum eventurum hoc siet,</quote> <trans><tr>where this may go to</tr>, <tr>how it may turn out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 118</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">eri semper lenitas Verebar quorsum evaderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quorsus haec pertinent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:24:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 24, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dices hodie, quorsum haec tam putida tendant,</quote> <trans><tr>whither this tends</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorsum pertinuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorsum abeant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorsum igitur haec spectat tam longa, tam alte repetita oratio?</quote> <trans><tr>at what does it aim?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:24:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 24, 91</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40288.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to what purpose? to what end? with what view? for what?</hi> quorsum igitur haec disputo? quorsum? ut intellegere possitis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Red. ad Quir. 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorsum tandem, aut cur ista quaeris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorsus, inquam, istuc?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:85:292" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 85, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quor sum est opus?</quote> <trans><tr>for what is it needed?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 116</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40288.4" n="2" level="3"> * <hi rend="ital">From what cause? why?</hi> quorsum insanus? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 201</bibl>; Acron. ad loc. (but K. and H. read cursum; cf. Orell. ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>
quot: <entryFree id="n40289" type="main" key="quo^t"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏt</orth> (in MSS. often <orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏd</orth>), <sense id="n40289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. plur. indecl.</hi> [kindr. with Sanscr. kati, quot, like tot, Sanscr. tati]. </sense><sense id="n40289.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">how many</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as many</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>: quot sunt? <hi rend="ital">Sce.</hi> Totidem, quot ego et tu sumus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot homines, tot sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot homines, tot causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:32:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 32, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot dies erimus in Tusculano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot calamitates!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot orationum genera esse diximus, totidem oratorum reperiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 16, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idque declarat totidem quot dixit, scripta verbis oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:96:328" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 96, 328</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 27</bibl>;
