<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:225" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 225</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40289.2" n="B" level="2"> For quotiens; <cit><quote lang="la">toties, quot,</quote> <trans><tr>as often as</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40289.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in specifications of time, <hi rend="ital">all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every</hi>: quot diebus, <hi rend="ital">every day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daily</hi>: quot mensibus, <hi rend="ital">every month</hi>, <hi rend="ital">monthly</hi>: quot annis, often as one word, quotannis (in inscrr. also, QVOD ANNIS), <hi rend="ital">every year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annually</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot Kalendis petere cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot mensibus fodere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 43, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotannis tributa conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:53:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 53, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic illum vidi juvenem, Meliboee, quot annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot annos singula milia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: Pomponius scribit, nihil interesse, utrum in annos singulos, vel quot annis; an in singulos menses, vel quot mensibus; <cit><quote lang="la">an in singulos dies, vel quot diebus legatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:2:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedulum quot dies obibam culturae sacrorum ministerium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 267, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quotannis: <entryFree id="n40290" type="main" key="quo^tannis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏtannis</orth>, v. quot.</entryFree>
quotcumque: <entryFree id="n40291" type="main" key="quotcumque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quot-cumque</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n40291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">how many soever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as many as</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quotcumque senatus creverit, tot sunto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot ... quotcumque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 315</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quoteni: <entryFree id="n40292" type="main" key="quo^te_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏtēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n40292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. distrib. adj.</hi> [quot], <hi rend="ital">how many</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">is ita partes fecit, nescio quotenorum jugerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 33, 1</bibl></cit>: quotenos suae aetatis annos Christus absolverit, Ven. Carm. 6, 5.</sense></entryFree>
quotennis: <entryFree id="n40293" type="main" key="quo^tennis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏtennis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quot-annus</etym>, <sense id="n40293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of how many years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how many years old</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quotenne vinum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Quantit. Anim. 19" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Quantit. Anim. 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quotidiano: <entryFree id="n40294" type="main" key="quo^ti_di^a_no_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏtīdĭānō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. cottidianus <sense id="n40294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
quotidianus: <entryFree id="n40295" type="main" key="quo^ti_di^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏtī-dĭānus</orth>, v. cottidianus.</entryFree>
quotidie: <entryFree id="n40296" type="main" key="quo^ti_di^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏtīdĭē</orth>, v. cottidie.</entryFree>
quotidio: <entryFree id="n40297" type="hapax" key="quo^ti_di^o_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏtīdĭō</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cotīd-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> for cottidie, <sense id="n40297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daily</hi>, Q. Caepio ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 174</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
quotiens: <entryFree id="n40298" type="main" key="quo^ti^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏtĭens</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏtĭes</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quot</etym>, <sense id="n40298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">how often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how many times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as often as</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">o quotiens et quae nobis Galatea locuta est!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotiens et quot nominibus a Syracusanis statuas auferes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:59:section=145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 59, § 145</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:30:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 30, 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud soleo mirari, non me totiens accipere tuas litteras, quotiens a Quinto mihi fratre afferuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 483</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 9, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quotienscumque: <entryFree id="n40299" type="main" key="quo^ti^enscumque^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏtĭens-cumquĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n40299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">how often soever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as often soever as</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quotienscumque dico, totiens mihi videor in judicium venire, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 18, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:34:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 34, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc facite quotienscumque bibetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 11, 25</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1520" /> <cb n="QUUM" /></sense></entryFree>
quotiensque: <entryFree id="n40300" type="main" key="quo^ti^ensque^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏtĭens-quĕ</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quŏtĭesquĕ</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> for quotienscumque, <sense id="n40300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">how often soever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as often soever as</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quotiensque mel remediis adhibetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quotlibet: <entryFree id="n40301" type="hapax" key="quotli^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quot-lĭbet</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n40301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">as many as pleases</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as many as one will</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astron. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astron. 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
quotquot: <entryFree id="n40302" type="main" key="quotquo^t"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quot-quŏt</orth>, <sense id="n40302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. indecl.</hi> [quot]. </sense><sense id="n40302.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">how many soever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as many soever as</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si leges duae aut si plures aut quotquot erunt conservari non possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:49:145" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 49, 145</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 42, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotquot eunt dies,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>daily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotquot sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 7, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40302.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoquot annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=40" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 40</bibl></cit> Müll. al.: <cit><quote lang="la">mensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">47 ib. (al. quot mensibus): quotquot enim promissiones Dei sunt, in illo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 1, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quotumus: <entryFree id="n40303" type="main" key="quo^tu^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏtŭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quotus</etym>, <sense id="n40303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of what number</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">quotumas aedes dixerit, ego incerto scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: quotumo die, <hi rend="ital">on what day</hi> (by number)? <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7, 77</bibl>.‡ * <orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏtuplex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quotus-plico</etym>, <hi rend="ital">how many fold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how many times</hi>: quotuplex, <foreign lang="greek">o(sapla/sios,</foreign> Vet. Onomast.</sense></entryFree>
quotus: <entryFree id="n40304" type="main" key="quo^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>quot</etym>, <sense id="n40304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">which</hi> or <hi rend="ital">what in number</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">of what number</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how many</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quotus erit iste denarius, qui non sit ferendus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:94:section=220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 94, § 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scire velim, chartis pretium quotus arroget annus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quota pars illi rerum periere mearum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 522</bibl></cit>: hora quota est? <hi rend="ital">what o</hi>'<hi rend="ital">clock is it?</hi> (prop. <hi rend="ital">what is the number of the hour?</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scis, quota de Libyco litore puppis eat,</quote> <trans><tr>how many ships</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:36:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 36, 8</bibl></cit>: tu, quotus esse velis, rescribe, <hi rend="ital">of what number you wish to be</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">how many guests you would like to have invited with you</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 30</bibl>: pars quota laudis, <hi rend="ital">how great</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">how very small</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 12, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quota pars terraï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:652" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 652</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:5:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 5, 14</bibl>.—In connection with <hi rend="ital">quisque</hi> (also in one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏtusquisque</orth>) <itype>to designate a small number</itype>, <hi rend="ital">how few;</hi> it may also be rendered into English by <hi rend="ital">how many</hi> (in Cic. only in <case>nom.</case> and in principal clause): quotus enim quisque philosophorum invenitur, qui sit ita moratus, ut ratio postulat? <hi rend="ital">how many?</hi> i. e. <hi rend="ital">how few!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotus enim quisque disertus? quotus quisque juris peritus est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 25, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoto cuique lorica est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:3:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 20, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma quota quaeque superbit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotum quemque inveneris, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam quoto cuique eadem honestatis cura secreto, quae palam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 20, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repete memoriā tecum quotus quisque dies ut destinaveras recesserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoto quoque loco libebit,</quote> <trans><tr>in whatsoever place one may wish</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 17, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quotuscumque: <entryFree id="n40305" type="main" key="quo^tuscumque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏtus-cumque</orth>, <itype>tăcumque, tumcumque</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n40305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">whatsoever in number</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">how great</hi> or <hi rend="ital">small soever</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">moverit e votis pars quotacumque deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:54" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 54</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 60</bibl>, the true reading is quota quemque).</sense></entryFree>
quotuslibet: <entryFree id="n40306" type="main" key="quo^tusli^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏtus-lĭbet</orth>, <itype>tălibet, tumlibet</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n40306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of what number</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quotusquisque: <entryFree id="n40307" type="main" key="quo^tusquisque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏtusquisque</orth>, v. quotus.</entryFree>
quousque: <entryFree id="n40308" type="main" key="quo^usque_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quŏ-usquē</orth> (also separated, quo enim usque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 1, 3</bibl>: <sense id="n40308.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">quo te spectabimus usque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:64:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 64, 9</bibl></cit>), <pos>adv.</pos> </sense><sense id="n40308.1" n="I" level="1"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">until what time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">till when</hi>, <hi rend="ital">how long</hi> (class.): <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Quousque? <hi rend="ital">Li.</hi> Usque ad mortem volo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quousque humi defixa tua mens erit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quousque? inquies. Quoad erit integrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quousque ita dicis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:31:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 31, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quousque tandem abutere patientiā nostrā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40308.2" n="II" level="1"> Of place, <hi rend="ital">how far.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40308.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quousque penetratura sit avaritia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:N. H. 33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> N. H. 33</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">3: cum decessero de viā, quousque degredi debeo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40308.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">how far</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to what extent</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quousque ei permissum videatur peculium administrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 20, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quovis: <entryFree id="n40309" type="main" key="quo_vi_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quō-vīs</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quivis</etym>, <sense id="n40309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to any place whatever</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): cibo perduci poteris quovis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quovis admittunt aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gentium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo abeat quovis gentium,</quote> <trans><tr>let him go anywhere in the world</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
quum: <entryFree id="n40310" type="main" key="quum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quum</orth>, <sense id="n40310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi>, v. 2. cum.</sense></entryFree>
quummaxime: <entryFree id="n40311" type="main" key="quummaxime"><orth extent="full" lang="la">quummaxime</orth>, v. 2. cum. <cb n="RABI" /> <cb n="R." /></entryFree>
r: <entryFree id="n40312" type="main" key="R"><orth extent="full" lang="la">R</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">r</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>n.</gen> or (sc. littera) <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n40312.0" n="I" level="1"> The seventeenth letter of the Latin alphabet, which derives its form from the Greek P, but is not, like that, aspirated. Thus Burrus, arrabo, were originally written for <foreign lang="greek">*pu/rros, a)rrabw/n.</foreign> In words borrowed from the Greek, an <hi rend="ital">h</hi> was subsequently appended to the <hi rend="ital">r</hi>, as a sign of the spiritus asper. On account of its vibratory sound, resembling the snarling of a dog, <hi rend="ital">r</hi> is called by Persius littera canina, Sat. 1, 109; cf. Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 100</bibl> P. — </sense><sense id="n40312.1" n="II" level="1"> In many words, <hi rend="ital">r</hi> medial and final (but not initial) represents an original <hi rend="ital">s.</hi> Tradition ascribes the introduction of <hi rend="ital">r</hi> for <hi rend="ital">s</hi> to Appius Claudius Caecus, consul 446 and 457 A. U. C., or to L. Papirius Crassus, consul 417 A. U. C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 2</bibl>. Examples of a change of <hi rend="ital">s</hi> into <hi rend="ital">r</hi> are: asa, lases, plusima, meliosem, meliosibus, foedesum, Fusius, Papisius, Valesius, fusvos, janitos, into ara, lares, plurima, meliorem, melioribus, foederum, Furius, Papirius, Valerius, furvus, janitor; heri (compared with hesternus and the Greek <foreign lang="greek">xqe/s</foreign>); so, too, dirimo is formed from dis-emo. Cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 26</bibl> Müll.; Cic. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Scaur. p. 2252</bibl> and 2258 P.; Fest. s. v. Aureliam, p. 20; R pro S, p. 134; pignosa, p. 198. Both sounds have maintained their place in some substantives of the third declension ending in <hi rend="ital">or</hi> or <hi rend="ital">os</hi> (arbor, color, honor, labor, lepor, etc., and also arbos, colos, honos, labos, lepos, etc.); so in quaeso, quaesumus, also written quaero, quaerimus; cf. nasus and naris, pulvis and pulver, etc.— The converse change of an original <hi rend="ital">r</hi> into <hi rend="ital">s</hi> appears very doubtful. Forms like hesternus (from heri), festus (also feriae), ustum (from uro), etc., indicate rather an original <hi rend="ital">s</hi>, when compared with arbustum also arboretum, and majusculus also major.— For the relation of the <hi rend="ital">r</hi> to <hi rend="ital">d</hi> and <hi rend="ital">l</hi>, v. D and L. —</sense><sense id="n40312.2" n="III" level="1"> R is assimilated, </sense><sense id="n40312.3" n="a" level="4"> Most freq. before <hi rend="ital">l</hi>: libellus, tenellus, intellego, pellicio, from liber, tener, inter-lego, per-lacio, v. the art. per. — </sense><sense id="n40312.4" n="b" level="4"> Before <hi rend="ital">s</hi>: dossuarius, from dorsum. — </sense><sense id="n40312.5" n="IV" level="1"> R is elided in pejero (from perjuro), and in the forms crebesco, rubesco, susum, also written crebresco, rubresco, sursum, etc. — </sense><sense id="n40312.6" n="V" level="1"> As an abbreviation, R. signifies Romanus, also Rufus, recte, reficiendum, regnum, ripa, et mult. al.; R.P. respublica; R.R. rationes relatae (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=228" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 228</bibl> Müll.).</sense></entryFree>
rabide: <entryFree id="n40313" type="main" key="ra^bi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răbĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. rabidus <sense id="n40313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rabidus: <entryFree id="n40314" type="main" key="ra^bi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răbĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. rabo</etym>, <sense id="n40314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">raving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enraged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rabid</hi> (as <pos>adj.</pos> mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">furens, furiosus, insanus): canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:892" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 892</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 5, 32, § 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:1:15:2" default="NO">1, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:3:30:1" default="NO">3, 30, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 99:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 99, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">catuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:127" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus (Canis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 151</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">leones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 712</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 393</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupa, Ov A. A. 3, 8: bimembres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 494</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alios age incitatos, alios age rabidos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non impulsus et rabidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:12:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40314.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelorum (on account of the neighboring Scylla),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 66</bibl></cit> Cort. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit> (4, 7), 11; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">murmur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:239" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut rabida ora quierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 102</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectus (draconis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 49, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:410" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 410</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:253" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fames (Cerberi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 421</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sitis (Tantali),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1077" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1077</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 44</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40314.2" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">impulsive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passionate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impetuous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impulsus et rabidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:12:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 3:16:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furor animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 501</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabida et jurgiosa facundia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">răbĭ-dē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">ravingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">madly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rabidly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia rabide appetentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">raptari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mor. Manich. 2:14" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mor. Manich. 2, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rabies: <entryFree id="n40315" type="main" key="ra^bi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răbĭes</orth>, <itype>em, e</itype> (<sense id="n40315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> rabies, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1083" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1083</bibl>; the other cases do not occur), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rabio</etym>. </sense><sense id="n40315.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">madness</hi> (cf.: furor, insania). </sense><sense id="n40315.2" n="1" level="3"> Of dogs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 15, 13, § 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:99" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 5, 32, § 99</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40315.3" n="2" level="3"> Of other animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:35" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 18, 26, § 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ursina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 36, 54, § 130</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40315.4" n="3" level="3"> Of men, <hi rend="ital">madness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frenzy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7</bibl>, prooem. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 1, § 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 26</bibl>; cf.: contactos eo scelere velut injectā<cb n="RACE" />  rabie ad arma ituros, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:48:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 48, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40315.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of any violent emotion, <hi rend="ital">rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierceness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eagerness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hecubam putant propter animi acerbitatem quandam et rabiem fingi in canem esse conversam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine rabie,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 24, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Archilochum proprio rabies armavit iambo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 79</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 149</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dico horrendam rabiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 323</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:64:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 64, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civica,</quote> <trans><tr>fierce civil war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 64</bibl></cit>. — Of the madness of love. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1079" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1079</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:9" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 9</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Of the Sibyl's inspiration,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 49</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40315.6" n="b" level="4"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">rabies fatalis temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Noti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelique marisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:802" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 802</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:290" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Canis,</quote> <trans><tr>the fierce heat of the dogstar</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>ravenous hunger</tr>, <tr>voracity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 357</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:472" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 472</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rabio: <entryFree id="n40316" type="main" key="ra^bi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răbĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>, <sense id="n40316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be mad</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose), Varr. and Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 40, 2 sq.</bibl>: oculis rabere visa es ardentibus, Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:5:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5, 207</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 222</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 29:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 29, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rabiose: <entryFree id="n40317" type="main" key="ra^bi^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răbĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. rabiosus <sense id="n40317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rabiosulus: <entryFree id="n40318" type="hapax" key="ra^bi^o_su^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răbĭōsŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n40318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [rabiosus], <hi rend="ital">a little rabid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rabiosus: <entryFree id="n40319" type="main" key="ra^bi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răbĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rabies</etym>, <sense id="n40319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">raving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rabid</hi> (rare but class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: furiosus, furibundus): canis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 5, 32, § 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: fortitudo, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:22:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 22, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabiosa barbaraque vox,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 96, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridor (anserum sacrorum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 136, 4</bibl></cit>. — * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">răbĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">ravingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">madly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiercely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rabidly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil iracunde rabioseve fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:22:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 22, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rabirius: <entryFree id="n40320" type="main" key="Ra^bi_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Răbīrĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n40320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. Thus, </sense><sense id="n40320.1" n="1" level="3"> C. Rabirius, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people;</hi> and, </sense><sense id="n40320.2" n="2" level="3"> C. Rabirius Postumus, <hi rend="ital">a knight;</hi> both of them defended by Cicero in orations still extant.— </sense><sense id="n40320.3" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An indifferent philosophical writer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 5</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40320.4" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An excellent poet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P 4, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:90" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 90</bibl>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n40320.5" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Răbīrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Rabirius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Rabirian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rabo: <entryFree id="n40321" type="main" key="ra^bo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răbo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, v. rabio.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n40322" type="main" key="ra^bo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răbo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, = arrhabo, v. arrha.</entryFree>
rabocentus: <entryFree id="n40323" type="main" key="Rabocentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rabocentus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n40323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Bessic prince</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put to death by L. Piso</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rabula: <entryFree id="n40324" type="main" key="ra^bu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răbŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. rabo</etym>, <sense id="n40324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a brawling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrangling advocate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pettifogger</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">clamator, declamator): non declamatorem aliquem de ludo aut rabulam de foro ... quaerimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:15:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 15, 47</bibl></cit>; with <hi rend="ital">causidicus</hi> and <hi rend="ital">proclamator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 46</bibl>. 202; with <hi rend="ital">latrator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 12</bibl>; cf. Fest. s. v. rava vox, p. 137 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 26, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">60, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rabulana: <entryFree id="n40325" type="hapax" key="ra^bu^la_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răbŭlāna</orth> <itype>pix</itype>, <sense id="n40325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown kind of pitch</hi> [perh. ravus, grayish], <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 19, 24, § 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rabulatus: <entryFree id="n40326" type="hapax" key="ra^bu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răbŭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rabula</etym>, <sense id="n40326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a brawling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrangling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pettifogging</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, 46</bibl> Graev. dub. (Kopp, § 213, reboatu).</sense></entryFree>
rabuscula: <entryFree id="n40327" type="main" key="ra^buscu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răbuscŭla</orth> <itype>vitis</itype>, <sense id="n40327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown species of vine</hi> [perh. ravus, grayish], <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
racco: <entryFree id="n40328" type="main" key="racco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">racco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to utter the natural cry of the tiger</hi>, Auct. Carm. Philom. 49 (al. rancant).</sense></entryFree>
racemarius: <entryFree id="n40329" type="main" key="ra^ce_ma_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răcēmārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>racemus</etym>, <sense id="n40329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to grape-stalks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stalky</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pampini,</quote> <trans><tr>that bear nothing but stalks</tr>, <tr>unfruitful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 18, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
racematio: <entryFree id="n40330" type="hapax" key="ra^ce_ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răcēmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <sense id="n40330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">the gleaning of a vineyard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a grape-gleaning</hi> (cf. spicilegium), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
racematus: <entryFree id="n40331" type="hapax" key="ra^ce_ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răcēmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having clusters</hi> or <hi rend="ital">berries</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
racemifer: <entryFree id="n40332" type="main" key="ra^ce_mi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răcēmĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>racemusfero</etym>, <sense id="n40332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cluster-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clustering;</hi> a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet: uvae, Ov M. 3, 666; <cit><quote lang="la">and in a broader sense: racemifer Bacchus,</quote> <trans><tr>crowned with clusters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 15:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 413</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli (Bacchi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:F. 6:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 483</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
racemor: <entryFree id="n40333" type="hapax" key="ra^ce_mor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răcēmor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n40333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [racemus], <hi rend="ital">to glean;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">to treat of in a supplementary manner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
racemosus: <entryFree id="n40334" type="main" key="ra^ce_mo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răcēmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of clusters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clustering</hi> (Plin.): pomum, Plin. <pb n="1521" /> <cb n="RADI" /> 13, 4, 7, § <cit><quote lang="la">30: flos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:13:6:12:section=54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 6, 12, § 54</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
racemus: <entryFree id="n40335" type="main" key="ra^ce_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răcēmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">r(a/c, r(ago/s</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n40335.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the stalk of a cluster</hi> of grapes and similar plants: <cit><quote lang="la">alia (poma) racemis dependent, ut uvae, palmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 28, 34, § 115</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 26, 48, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:43" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 3, 4, § 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt et mora cruenta, et lentis uva racemis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Copa, 21</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40335.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40335.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bunch</hi> of berries, <hi rend="ital">cluster</hi> of grapes: <cit><quote lang="la">fert uva racemos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 484</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 2, 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 11 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecti de vite racemi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 703</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:208 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 208 al.</bibl> — </sense><sense id="n40335.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Wine</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">donec eras mixtus nullis, Acheloë, racemis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:343" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 343</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
racilius: <entryFree id="n40336" type="main" key="Racilius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Racilius</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Racilia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n40336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens; <cit><quote lang="la">e. g. L. Racilius,</quote> <trans><tr>a tribune of the people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:12:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 12, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 2</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40336.1" n="2" level="3"> Racilia, <hi rend="ital">wife of Cincinnatus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
radians: <entryFree id="n40337" type="main" key="ra^di^ans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rădĭans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, v. radio, II. B.</entryFree>
radiatilis: <entryFree id="n40338" type="hapax" key="ra^di^a_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rădĭātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>radio</etym>, <sense id="n40338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">emitting rays</hi>, <hi rend="ital">radiant</hi>: umbra, Ven. Fort. 2, 286.</sense></entryFree>
radiatio: <entryFree id="n40339" type="main" key="ra^di^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rădĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glittering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a beamy lustre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">radiation</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">marmoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 32</bibl></cit>: stellarum, Jul. Firm. Math. 1, 4. — <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 208</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
radiatus: <entryFree id="n40340" type="main" key="ra^di^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rădĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. radio, II. A.</entryFree>
radicalis: <entryFree id="n40341" type="main" key="ra_di_ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rādīcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>radix</etym>, <sense id="n40341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having roots</hi> (post-class.), Aug. c. Faust. 13, 12.</sense></entryFree>
radicatus: <entryFree id="n40342" type="main" key="ra_di_ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rādīcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. radicor.</entryFree>
radicesco: <entryFree id="n40343" type="hapax" key="ra_di_cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rādīcesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n40343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [radix], <hi rend="ital">to take root</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
radicitus: <entryFree id="n40344" type="main" key="ra_di_ci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rādīcĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with the roots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by the roots</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n40344.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">effodere herbas malas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concidere rosetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:35:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 35, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 288</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">evellere arborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eximere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:33:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auferre ungues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit> (4, 6), 51 al. — </sense><sense id="n40344.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">by the roots</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">utterly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">radically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radicitus tollere atque extrahere cupiditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 9, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">extrahere religionem ex animis hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:43:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 43, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excutere opinionem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia malefacta vostra repperi radicitus,</quote> <trans><tr>thoroughly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
radico: <entryFree id="n40345" type="main" key="ra_di_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rādīco</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">rādīcor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n40345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to strike root</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take root</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n40345.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40345.2" n="1" level="3"> Form radico, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> H. E. 2, 6</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40345.3" n="2" level="3"> Form radicor: <cit><quote lang="la">mergi facile radicantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:2:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 8, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:51 al" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 7, 10, § 51 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rādīcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">having roots</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 2 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n40345.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">et radicavi in populo honorificato (i. e. ego sapientia),</quote> <trans><tr>have found a home</tr>, <tr>struck root</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 24, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in caritate radicati et fundati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eph. 3, 17</bibl></cit>. —<orth extent="full" lang="la">rādīcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">rooted</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
radicosus: <entryFree id="n40346" type="hapax" key="ra_di_co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rādīcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of roots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having many roots</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia hederarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 34, 62, § 151</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
radicula: <entryFree id="n40347" type="main" key="ra_di_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rādīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n40347.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a small root</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rootlet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:66:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 66, 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40347.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40347.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Fuller</hi>'<hi rend="ital">sweed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soapwort</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 18, § 48</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40347.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A small kind of radish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:19" default="NO">11, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:21" default="NO" valid="yes">21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:29 al" default="NO" valid="yes">29 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
radio: <entryFree id="n40348" type="main" key="ra^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rădĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> <etym>radius</etym>. * <sense id="n40348.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to radius, I. B. 1.) <hi rend="ital">V. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to furnish with spokes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rota radiata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40348.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to radius, II.) <hi rend="ital">V. a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n40348.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to furnish with beams</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make beaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irradiate;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be irradiated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gleam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emit beams.</hi>—<usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">galeae gemmis radientur et auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:103" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 4, 103</bibl></cit>. — Esp. freq. in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rădĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">furnished with rays</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irradiated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shining</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles ut adverso Phoebi radiatus ab ictu,</quote> <trans><tr>irradiated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubent radiati lumina solis,</quote> <trans><tr>shining</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 462</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 41, 126</bibl></cit>; cf. also: orbis flammeus solis, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 44</bibl>: lumen (solis), Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:40:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 40, 162</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 193</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insigne diei (i. e. sol),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:699" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 699</bibl></cit>: caput, <hi rend="ital">surrounded with a halo</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nimbus</hi> (the attribute of deities and deified personages), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:52" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 52</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendor radiatus lampade solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:143" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 143</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40348.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to emit beams</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to beam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">radiate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40348.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">felium in tenebris fulgent radiantque oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 150</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 3, 9</bibl>; <cb n="RADI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles radiabat in armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:468" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 468</bibl>: radiabunt tempora nati (of the halo of deified personages, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, A.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:629" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 629</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:586" default="NO">2, 586</bibl>. — Freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rădĭans</orth>, <hi rend="ital">beaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shining</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:325" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 214</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 325</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 272</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=172" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 636</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">galea claro ab auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 451</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 616</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carbunculi pinnato fulgore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 93</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40348.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">radiate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi de industriă prospera ejus (fortuna) adversis radiaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:30" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 30</bibl></cit> Halm. (Duker, radiarentur): <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi inter medios roseā radiante juventā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:257" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitutio, quae inter imperiales radiat sanctiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: radiantia signa, <hi rend="ital">asterisks</hi>, Hier. praef. in Psa.</sense></entryFree>
radiolus: <entryFree id="n40349" type="main" key="ra^di^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rădĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>radius</etym>. * <sense id="n40349.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeble sunbeam</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 4, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40349.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of long olive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:49:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 49, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40349.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant resembling fern</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
radiosus: <entryFree id="n40350" type="hapax" key="ra^di^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rădĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">emitting many beams</hi>, <hi rend="ital">radiant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
radius: <entryFree id="n40351" type="main" key="ra^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rădĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf.: radix, ramus</etym>, <sense id="n40351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a staff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rod.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40351.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">acuti radii immissi,</quote> <trans><tr>stakes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferreus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 42, 58, § 117</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40351.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40351.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A spoke</hi> of a wheel, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 76, § 206</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 444</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 616</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 317</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:414" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 414</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter radios rotarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 9, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 76, § 206</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40351.4" n="2" level="3"> In mathematics, </sense><sense id="n40351.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A staff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rod</hi>, for measuring, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:850" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 850</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 9</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40351.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A semidiameter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">radius</hi> of a circle, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40351.7" n="3" level="3"> In weaving, <hi rend="ital">a shuttle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1352</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 476</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40351.8" n="4" level="3"> In zoology, </sense><sense id="n40351.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The spur</hi> of many kinds of birds, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 47, 107, § 257</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. of the cock,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 11, 29, § 97</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40351.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The sting above the tail of the fish</hi> pastinaca, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 48, 72, § 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:25" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 2, 12, § 25</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40351.11" n="5" level="3"> In botany, <hi rend="ital">a kind of long olive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 17:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 3, 4, § 13</bibl>. A sub-species of the same, called radius major, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 24</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40351.12" n="6" level="3"> In anatomy, <hi rend="ital">the radius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the exterior bone of the forearm</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kerki/s,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40351.13" n="7" level="3"> Radius virilis = membrum virile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:14:115" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 14, 115</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40351.14" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A beam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ray</hi> of any shining object; <cit><quote lang="la">of the sun,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:117" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:24:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 24, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 119</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 47</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of lightning,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 429</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:55" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 55</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the eyes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:16:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the halo around the heads of divine or deified personages: aurati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 163</bibl></cit>; cf. radio, II.</sense></entryFree>
radix: <entryFree id="n40352" type="main" key="ra_dix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rādix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype> (<sense id="n40352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> radicium, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> H. E. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Itin. Alex. 32" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Itin. Alex. 32</bibl> (75)), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">r(i/za,</foreign> a root; <foreign lang="greek">r(a/dic,</foreign> a shoot or twig; cf. ramus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a root</hi> of a plant (cf. stirps). </sense><sense id="n40352.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40352.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (mostly in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">radices agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to strike root</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:37" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 254</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 31, 56, § 127</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">infra, II.: capere radices,</quote> <trans><tr>to take root</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 133, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 17, 27, § 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">penitus immittere radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emittere radices e capite, ex se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 18, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:13" default="NO">5, 10, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">descendunt radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 31, 56, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores ab radicibus subruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 27, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbas radice revellit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radicibus eruta pinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 449</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetem ab radicibus imis eruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 319</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(arbos) quae, quantum vertice ad auras, tantum radice in Tartara tendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 292</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 31, 56, § 128</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 147</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40352.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an edible root</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 48</bibl>; esp. <hi rend="ital">a radish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syriaca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:59" default="NO">59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">also simply radix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:666 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 666 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcis,</quote> <trans><tr>licorice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 170" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 170</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40352.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40352.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The root</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the lower part</hi> of an object, <hi rend="ital">the foot</hi> of a hill, mountain, etc.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">in radicibus Caucasi natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in radicibus Amani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub ipsis radicibus montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 51</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 69; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 85, 1</bibl> et saep. — In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Palatii radice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:45:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 45, 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 66, § 180</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40352.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">That upon which any thing is fixed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rests</hi> (e. g. the tongue, a feather, a rock); <hi rend="ital">a root</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foundation</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; used alike in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 557</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:583" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 583</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 713</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40352.7" n="3" level="3"> Radix <cb n="RAET" /> virilis = membrum virile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:13" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40352.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a root</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">basis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foundation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">origin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">source</hi> (almost entirely in the <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">vera gloria radices agit atque etiam propagatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 12, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus altissimis defixa radicibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audeamus non solum ramos amputare miseriarum, sed omnes radicum fibras evellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:6:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilitatis et patientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius eo robore vir, iis radicibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>so deeply rooted</tr>, <tr>firmly established in the State</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illic radices, illic fundamenta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a radicibus evertere domum,</quote> <trans><tr>from its foundation</tr>, <tr>utterly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 10, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex iisdem, quibus nos, radicibus natum (C. Marium),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a native of the same city</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:22:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 22, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:8:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 8, 1</bibl>; cf. in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollinis se radice ortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego sum radix David,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:22:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 22, 16</bibl></cit> et saep.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of words,</quote> <trans><tr>origin</tr>, <tr>derivation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:5:61" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 5, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:7:3:88 al" default="NO">7, 3, 88 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
